Lolita has a general store business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned good, soft drinks, diapers and other groceries.

Lolita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned good, soft drinks, diapers and other groceries

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 58 years old, married with five children.

Clarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Clarita has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Clarita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elves

texts.en:
Elves is 58 years old and married with three children.  

Elves is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elves requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Elves has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

Elves would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Olifer

texts.es:
Olifer vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, su padre en empleado de una empresa y su madre es empleada doméstica .Sus metas futuras es recibirse de enfermera y poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en: Olifer lives in San Lorenzo with his parents and siblings.  His father works for a private company and his mother is a cleaner.  Olifer is studying for a nursing degree and hopes to build a career helping others.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to pay for college.  The investment will allow him to go on working toward his goal of a career in nursing.

loans.use: to pay for college expenses.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Good day lenders! This is Paulina. She is already 61 years old now. Flinging herself into managing her current sari-sari store business, she is hopeful that in no time, she will be able to finally get her dream house and have more businesses as well. But as of now she is working persistently with her husband Carlos to provide for the daily needs of her household. 

A sari-sari store is often seen everywhere in the Philippines, most especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is most likely a convenience store, but quite a sort of smaller than the usual and offers only limited products which are commonly needed, such as toiletries, food, instants, beverages and other commodities. Unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at low-cost and on a retail basis, which is really an advantage for the customers.

Making headway to improve her sales, Paulina would like to ask for help from you. She would like to borrow a loan of PHP 18,000 that she would use to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store. With this, she expects to grow her sales and provide a better remedy for their family’s daily living condition. And, today, you can be a big part of her life. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans

loans.use: to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store.

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is 43 years old. She is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and one child. She is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Russel wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 58 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus 3 menores hijos en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería principalmente.

El es albañil, adicionalmente brinda servicios como peón agricola, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de cemento, madera, pintura, entre otros productos para realizar arreglos en su vivienda y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 58 years old, and lives in his own house along with his life partner and their three younger sons in the rural area of the Pucará district, in the Jaén province of Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.  The people in this district work mainly in agriculture and stockbreeding.

He is a handyman but also works as a farm worker. He has experience in this business and counts with good personal and work references in his district. The loan will be used to buy cement, wood, and paint among other products to improve his house and thus improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, wood, and paint among other products to improve his house.

loans.name: Jenife

texts.en:
Jenife is 33 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jenife has a raising-pigs business in the Philippines. Jenife requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase vitamins, feeds and vaccines for her pigs.

Jenife has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jenife would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feeds and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and has two children. Jocelyn is married and has two children who are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jocelyn has been raising livestock for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ma. Alma

texts.en:
Ma. Alma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Alma is 33 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Ma. Alma has a buy-and-sell root-crops business in the Philippines. Ma. Alma requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more root crops to sell to her customers.

Ma. Alma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more root crops to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gerael Gay

texts.en:
Gerael Gay is 31 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for herself.

Gerael Gay runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Gerael Gay would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 31 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has been buying and selling livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay college expenses.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz tiene el deseo de tener algún negocio propio y poder emprender-lo, es por ello que está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas.
Ella es una persona que está po-niendo todo de sí para poder crecer y mejorar
Pide este préstamo para poder pa-gar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir luchando por cumplir con sus metas y anhelos.
texts.en: Liz is studying Business Administration and hopes to build her own business one day.  She is fully committed to moving forward and making the most of her life.  For now, she is applying for a loan that she will use to pay college expenses.  The investment will allow her to continue studying and fulfilling her dream of a career in business.

loans.use: to pay college expenses.

loans.name: Ellen Grace

texts.en: In 2012, Ellen Grace learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Ellen Grace tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Ellen Grace was loaned another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Ellen Grace looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and compost

loans.name: Ranil

texts.en:
It just takes a seed of faith to move mountains. 

This is Ranil. He was able to repay the loan he got previously of PHP 20,000. This couldn't be possible without your help, lenders. Thank you so much! Through you, he was able to buy enough supplies of ingredients needed for his business, thus paving a way to a better remedy for their family's daily expenses. 

Growing his business, he would like to ask again for a loan of PHP 20,000. This would be a big help for his food stall. He would use this amount to improve his food stall business by acquiring more stocks of ingredients needed in his recipes. 

Help Ranil see a glimpse of a better future through your generosity today. With a dream to have his own inventory expanding and see his children become professionals in the future and grow in their faith, he works very hard to help his wife Liza sustain the family. 

Ranil meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to improve his food stall business by acquiring more stocks of ingredients needed in his recipes.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
Zulfiya is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is lives in a small town with her family. She is divorced with one child.

For almost seven years she has been sewing traditional women's dresses. She likes her duties and her permanent clients are satisfied. She wants to do her business more efficiently and buy a new sewing machine. So she is asking for financial support from Kiva and IMON to buy a new sewing machine.

She awaits Kiva lenders support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ophelia is 30 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Ophelia has a raising-pigs business in the Philippines. Ophelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ophelia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ophelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Metelin

texts.en:
Metelin works hard to support her family. Metelin is married and has a buy-and-sell health products business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of health products to sell.

Metelin has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Metelin would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of health products to sell

loans.name: Uoy's Group

texts.en: Uoy is 31 years old and a married mother of two children. One of the children is in school, while the other one is too young to go to school. She is a rice farmer and wood charcoal seller living in Pursat province. She has been involved in these businesses for 13 years and earns about 100,700 KHR per day. Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group of two to apply for a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pay for a plowing fee. She hopes to earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pay for a plowing fee

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is an artisan from Peru who specializes in crocheted 100% alpaca wool apparel and accessories. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool.

Maria has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is her story:

"I learned the textile arts little by little, watching my aunts, friends and knitters from the time I was very young," recalls Maria. "Every day I liked this work more and more, so I practiced and practiced until I could knit and crochet myself. What makes me really happy is looking at a finished piece, admiring it and making sure it's an attractive design of good quality. I enjoy demonstrating the ability that we women have in our own hands, and that we can get ahead through our own work."

"Many thanks for your support. With this microcredit, we will be able to get ahead and build up our inventory."

Use the link below to view Maria's crocheted 100% alpaca wool apparel and accessories on the NOVICA site: 

http://www.novica.com/kiva/8351

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool.

loans.name: Carlina

texts.es:
Carlina es de la ciudad de encarnación, está estudiando la carrera de odontología, comenta que está casada y que vive con sus padres.
Ella está poniendo todo de sí para poder terminar su carrera, y con ello poder ser una profesional útil para las demás personas y para su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la cuota de sus carreras, y con ello poder estar más cerca de cumplir con sus anhelos. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar.
texts.en: Carlina is from the city of Encarnacion.  She is married and lives with her parents.  She is studying dentistry and says that she is working hard to finish her degree.  Finishing will mean that she can start her career, one that will be useful to her, her family and her patients.  For now, she is applying for a loan that she will use to pay college expenses.  The investment will allow her to continue studying and working toward her goal of a career in dentistry.  She is grateful, she adds, for this chance to build a better future.

loans.use: to pay college expenses.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Silvana está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su profesión, y es por ello que se está esforzando al máximo para poder cumplir con sus metas.
Silvana quiere este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir estudiando para poder cumplir con sus metas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Silvana is studying nursing.  She wants to help others and is fully committed to meeting her goal of a career in nursing.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to pay college expenses.  The investment will allow her to continue her studies.  She is grateful, she says, for your loans and the opportunities they provide to her and other like her.

loans.use: to pay college expenses.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Thanks to you lenders! Recently, Mary Grace was granted a PHP 50,000 loan for her inventory. Having this amount, she ably bought more quantities of raw meat like pork and chicken for her stall in the market. Having been able to achieve greater sales, Mary Grace found a better source of income for the family. Thus, she was able to support the household's basic needs. 

However, she still needs a certain amount this time that will help her maintain the business operations. She is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 that she will use to obtain additional supplies and meat products to sell in her business. Your help today can be a great start for a better business and life that awaits Mary Grace. This is why she is very hopeful that you will grant her request. 

She dreams of her children graduating from college and being professionals someday. She also wants to expand her business.  

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to obtain additional supplies and meat products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Magfirat

texts.en: Magfirat is a skillful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in a small town with her family. She is divorced and has a child. She has many years of experience sewing national dresses for women. She takes orders at home and sews up-to-date dresses as her customers wish. Her business is doing well and she wants to work efficiently. She is planning to buy a computerized sewing machine and sew modern, stylish dresses. She requested a loan from IMON and Kiva to buy a computerized sewing machine. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine

loans.name: Jenyfer

texts.en:
Jenyfer is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jenyfer is 28 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jenyfer has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines. Jenyfer requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Jenyfer has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jenyfer would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Pelaria

texts.en:
Pelaria is 59 years old and married with five children.

Pelaria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Pelaria has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Pelaria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Wellin

texts.en:
Wellin is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children, both of whom are in school.

Wellin is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Wellin has been in this business for 6 years now, and she has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF so she can sustain it.

In the future, Wellin would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rechel works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell dried fish business and pig fattening. 

Rechel is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish nets, gasoline, bamboo, etc for her fishing business.

Rechel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets, gasoline, bamboo, etc for her fishing business

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en:
Phorn is a rural villager living in Mondulkiri province. A 30-year-old mother of one child who is in school, she has been growing cassava and working on another farm to earn additional income for five years. 

Phom is now leading a group of four to apply for a loan, her second, from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her portion to buy farming supplies to support her current business. 

Phom hopes the loan will help her to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Safarmoh

texts.en: Safarmoh is a talented woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1970. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has four children. For a year, she has been selling grocery products at her small store near her home. This is her first time applying to IMON to get a loan. Safarmoh needs to replenish her assortment of grocery products so she is asking for a loan to buy more products for her store. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy grocery products for her store

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena makes a living through her junk shop business and makes business with the use of her motorcycle. She runs a junk shop in Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, and earns a promising income to support her family. 

She has signed up for her membership with Paglaum MPC to gain access to capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. 

Now she availed a loan to purchase additional inventory and used as a down payment on a motorcycle for service use for the junk shop. Nena hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to use as a downpayment for a motorcycle

loans.name: María Monserrate Del Carmen

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador, conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y no tiene hijos. Su esposo es agricultor, viven con sus padres.
Doña María trabaja en un colegio como bibliotecaria y también se dedica a la venta  de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja de  Lunes a Viernes de 07h00 a 13h00 todos los días en el colegio, sus ventas realiza a sus compañeros del colegio y sus conocidos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene algún tiempo a esta actividad y le va muy bien,  lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Está  en el Grupo De Crédito hace un año y le gusta por la unidad del grupo. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the Manabí province in Ecuador, known for being the first and oldest city settled in the coastal region of the country. It is gaining ground in tourism since this canton has beach, city and countryside. 

In this place lives María, age 43, married and with no children. Her husband is a farmer and they live with his parents. María works in a school as a librarian and also works selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). 

She works at the school every day from Monday to Friday, from 7:00 am to 1:00 pm. She sells her products to her coworkers and acquaintances. She gives credit to her customers and collects every eight day. She has been doing this activity for a time now and has done it well. What she sells the most are perfumes and cosmetics.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics. She has been part of the Grupo de Crédito for the past year and she likes it for the group’s unity. Her dream is to have her own house and continue working.

loans.use: tu buy perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Requina

texts.en: Requina is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 21 years old, single, and has a retailing business in Sindangan. She does business on home visits around their neighborhood. This is how she supports her needs and helps her parents as well as their family. Recently, Requina requested a loan to restock inventory such as soap and perfume to resell. She wants to save more money for her plan to continue her college education.

loans.use: to restock inventory such as soap and perfume to resell

location.town: SINDANGAN-TAMIL, JOSE DALMAN, ZAMBONGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Criselda is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Criselda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, frozen foods, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Criselda has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, frozen foods, spices, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Saralyn

texts.en:
Saralyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Saralyn has been in this business for nine years. Saralyn earns more income from pig fattening and fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 60 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Ofelia has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Ofelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell for her buy-and-sell dried fish business.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a general store and raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Ngor

texts.en: Ngor is a rural villager living in Kratie province. She is a 50-year-old mother of eight children, only two of whom are in school. Growing rice and fishing have been the sources of her family’s income for 30 years and these earn her about 30,000 KHR per day. Due to lack of funds, she is now applying for a loan via VisionFund to buy cows to plow farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income and improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy cows to plow farmland

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
A 41-year-old mother of two children who are both in school, Kong is living in Kratie province. To overcome her family’s hardship, she feeds 20 pigs to sell and she is a rice seller as well. She has been involved in these businesses for more than five years and it earns her about 129,000KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds to expand her current business, she is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy more piglets and pig feed. 

She hopes her business will be expanded and improve her family’s standard of living through this loan.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon is a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province. She is a 33-year-old divorced woman who grows rice on one hectare farmland and works as a factory worker to earn income to support her living. She has been involved in these businesses for 15 years and she could earn about 66,700KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now taking a new loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her farming. 

She hopes to earn more income to expand her current business through this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Saliyahan

texts.ru: Салияхан, 55 лет, вдова, 7 детей, самый младший учится в школе. У нее среднее образование, Салияхан на пенсии, дети помогают во всем. Работу в селе найти очень тяжело, однако надо содержать семью. Поэтому уже 25 лет Салияхан занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. Ежемесячный доход Салияхан составляет 15,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Салияхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, что позволит ей улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Saliyahan is 55, widowed, and has seven children, the youngest of whom is in school. She has a high school education and is retired. Her children help her with everything. It is very difficult to find work in the village, but at the same time, it is necessary to provide for her family. This is why Saliyahan has been farming for over 25 years. She currently has two cows and earns 15,000 som (KGS) per month, which is not enough money to live on. In order to develop her business, she applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy cows to fatten and resell. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in the future development of her business, which will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and resale in order to increase her income

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en: Norn, 53, is a mother of three children living in Kampong Cham province. Tobacco farming and fishing have been the sources of her family’s income for more than five years. She earns about 51,400 KHR per day. Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group of two to take out a new loan from VisionFund to buy seed and pay for labor. She hopes to improve her family’s living standards through this loan.

loans.use: to buy seed and pay for labor

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.en: Muhabat is a strong woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She is living in a small city with her family. She is married and has four children. She has been a businesswoman for about 10 years. She has a business of buying and selling food items. She has a place in a domestic market where she sells butter, cheese, tea, etc. She appealed to IMON asking for help to get a loan to buy food for sale. She awaits Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy food for sale

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She is married to Vicente, a regular employee, and they have children.

Jocelyn runs three small enterprises, a “sari-sari” or variety store, a small canteen, and a water distribution service. Her income from these businesses can help provide for their everyday needs and the children’s education. Knowing that the competition is stiff and profits are irregular, Jocelyn dreams of expanding her businesses. She needs additional supplies in her variety store so as to meet the demands of customers who prefer to buy from a store with wide selections. She also desires to offer more meal choices in her canteen, and in due time, own a water refilling station.

Jocelyn knocks at your kind hearts for a loan assistance of PhP 25,000 which she can use as additional capital for her enterprises. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies in her variety store

loans.name: Diery

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Diery works hard to support her family.

She has a used clothes business in the Philippines and earns additional income from operating a boarding house and general store. Diery is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy used clothes to sell.
 
She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business. 

Diery has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell for her business

loans.name: Estrilla

texts.en:
Estrilla works hard to support her family. Estrilla is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Estrilla requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Estrilla has been in this business for five years now.

Estrilla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 36 years old and has four children. Eva is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Eva is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Eva has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eva would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 55 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Fatima works very hard to provide for them.

Fatima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Fatima has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as diapers, sanitary pads, bread, eggs, candies, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc. 

Fatima would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a 63-year-old married mother of seven children, three still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Concepcion has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Concepcion requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Concepcion has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Dony

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Dony, one of Ruma’s agents. Dony lives in Klaten, a regency in Central Java province in Indonesia, located about ten hours by train from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Dony owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides mobile payment services for his community. He joined Ruma almost one year ago. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came his stall. 

As the business grows, Dony needs a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Dony improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Dony is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en: Ren, 37, is a mother of three children, one in school. She is living in Kampong Cham province. Ren grows cassava on four hectares of farmland as the main source of her family’s income. She has been involved in this business for12 years and it earns her about 72,200 KHR per day. Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group of two to take out a new loan from VisionFund. As group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy pesticide and pay for labor. She hopes to gain more yield than last year and buy one more hectare of farm land to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and pay for labor

loans.name: Lis

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Lis, one of Ruma’s agents. Lis lives in Sumedang, located in West Java, about 4-5 hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married. Together with her husband, they have one cute daughter. Lis owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides electricity bill payment services for her community. She joined Ruma almost one year ago. She knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to her stall.

As the business grows, Lis is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Lis improve her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Lis is the one who is standing. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 31 años emprendió su propio negocio de venta de ropa exterior e interior muy motivada y entusiasta, esta carismática mujer no contaba con un capital de riesgo por lo que solicitó un préstamo para financiar su idea de negocio.  En la actualidad tiene dos años de estar ejerciendo esta actividad con muy buenos resultados, ofreciendo una gama amplia de productos mediante catálogos de diferentes marcas y productos; utensilios de cocina, ropa exterior e interior y accesorios.  En la actualidad se dedica de lunes a sábado en el horario de 7a.m a 6 p.m. a impulsar sus ventas a vecinos y familiares, y para cumplir con la entrega de unos pedidos está aplicando a su primer Credikiva, por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar ropa interior, ropa para dama y utensilios de cocina como ollas, sartenes antiadherentes y vasos.  Su meta de negocio es fortalecerse como una empresaria para ofrecerles a sus tres hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old María started her own business selling outer garments and underwear. This very motivated, enthusiastic and charismatic woman did not have capital, so she requested a loan to finance her business idea. 

She has been carrying out her business with very good results for two years, offering a wide range of products through catalogs with different brands and products, including kitchenware, outer garments, underwear and accessories. She currently works Monday through Saturday from 7 AM to 6 PM. 

María is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy underwear, women's clothing and kitchenware such as pots, non-stick pans and glasses in order to boost her sales to neighbors and family members and fulfill delivery of some orders. 

Her business goal is to become a stronger businesswoman in order to provide a better future for her three children.

loans.use: to buy underwear, women's clothing and kitchenware such as pots, non-stick pans and glasses.

loans.name: Inti Waras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INTI WARAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosmery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de fruta, venta de huevos, servicio de transporte, tienda de barrio, venta de ollas de presión, venta de bisutería y venta de ropa..

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer Pro Mujer, por la invitación de una asesora que fue a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace catorce años.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de papa, arroz y fideo por mayor) que adquirirá de vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Inti Waras community association will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Regional Center.  The group is made up of eight members and is led by a board where Rosmery is the President.  The members of the group have different businesses, including: food sales, fruit sales, egg sales, transportation services, a neighborhood store, pressure cooker sales, jewelry sales, and clothing sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners like Rosmery.  She joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a consultant who came to her home.  She has a business selling food.  She learned this business from her mother 14 years ago.

She is requesting this loan to increase her capital so she can purchase potatoes, rice, and pasta at wholesale.  She will make her purchases from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto, and later she will make the food and sell it in her sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially.  She is common-law married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the trainings the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, rice, and pasta at wholesale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Living in an area frequently visited by typhoons is not that easy, especially if the sea serves as source of family income. The city of Bacolod in Negros Occidental has a bordering sea on one side that provides a lot of benefits to the people in the community. But in November 2013, the area was devastated by Typhoon Haiyan, a super typhoon that’s famous for its ruthless wrath. Elizabeth, her husband Melchor, and their four children were lucky to survive the harsh calamity with the grace of God. 

Elizabeth owns a fishing boat and several fishing nets. There was a time after the typhoon that these became useless due to severe damage in the sea. Fortunately, the family has alternative income with the help of their “trisikad.” Elizabeth also operates three units of trisikad that are being used as transportation service in their community. “Trisikad” is a three-wheeled vehicle just like the tricycle, but it doesn’t use gasoline or diesel to run. Just the power of “sikad” or kick makes a trisikad run.  Simply put, it’s a bicycle with attached compartment or section for passengers. Elizabeth is able to help unemployed, low-educated but hardworking men in their community by hiring them as trisikad drivers.

Elizabeth’s experience during Haiyan further strengthens her resolve to improve her business. She humbly requests a PHP 15,000 loan to be used partly to buy additional materials for fishing nets, and partly to pay the downpayment for another unit of “trisikad. Furthermore, she plans to acquire another fishing boat in the near future. One of her dreams is that her children will manage a transportation business both in land and sea after finishing college. She’s hoping that you would be an instrument to achieve her goals. 

Elizabeth is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay the downpayment for another unit of "trisikad," a three-wheeled vehicle that doesn't  use gasoline or diesel

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and married with three children. She earns a living through her pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years and earns additional income from fish vending.

Evelyn is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Grace is 41 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Grace has a fishing business in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials and spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

Grace has been in this business for five years. In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials and spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Indelicia

texts.en:
Indelicia is 39 years old and married with four children.

Indelicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Indelicia has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Indelicia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dewi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Dewi, one of Ruma’s agents. She lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about a 5-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married, and together with her husband, they have one cute son. 

Dewi owns a stall where she sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. She joined Ruma almost a year ago. She knew about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business into technology. 

As her business grows, Dewi is hoping to take a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to customers in her community. Your loan will be very useful in helping Dewi improve her business and, accordingly, her community who need access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Dewi is standing in her own stall. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to buy more mobile airtime credits to resell and give her community better access to communication services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk in bulk for her husband's milk selling business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married with seven school-aged children and one infant. She has been a tricycle driver for 17 years. 

Because of the size of her big happy family, her husband's income is not enough to cover their expenses. She is thankful that she became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative because she was able to avail a loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle.  

Now, she requires a loan to renew her motor franchise. She will use the remaining amount to start a sari-sari (variety store) to help support her family.  

She hopes her children will finish their degrees and will be happy to see that happen.

loans.use: to pay to renew her motor franchise

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 47 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials like fishing net, gasoline, fish containers, etc. for her business.

Marcelina has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like fishing net, gasoline, fish containers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 69 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar and noodles. 

Mercidita has requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

In the future, Mercidita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Letricia

texts.en:
Letricia is a hardworking woman and a loving single mother to her two children. She has worked at the same profession for more than 16 years, and is currently enrolled in college to further her education. This is so she can better provide for her young children, as well as positively influencing them to always pursue their dreams. 

Letricia’s goal is to finish her degree in Health Care Administration so that she can fulfill her dream of helping others in the same way that she has helped her mother. Recently, her mother became unemployed and completely dependent upon Letricia due to a disability. Letricia hopes to one day use her knowledge and the experience she will gain to open an adult day care facility. Her goal is that the adult day care facility will cater to people who have elderly and/or disabled family members who require care, assistance and/or supervision during the day. 

Letricia is managing to juggle all of her obligations, but she is currently in need of assistance. Letricia’s credit history has been negatively affected due to medical bills associated with the death of a child. Letricia has been making strides toward paying on her balances owed, but the damage to her credit is done. She currently needs a new roof for her home, and has been unable to finance the project due to her credit score. Her roof is currently leaking in several places, including her children’s bedroom. Letricia is concerned that her children may become sick due to the growth of mold in their damp ceiling. For this reason, Letricia is hoping that SELF and Kiva can help finance a new roof for her home, which will improve the living environment and make the home safe and healthy for Letricia and her family. 

Letricia will use her Kiva loan to purchase a new roof that will improve the health of her family, as well as the living environment and safety of her home.

loans.use: to purchase a new roof that will improve the health of her family, as well as the living environment and safety of her home.

loans.name: Colibri Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario “ Colibrí”  esta conformado por tres socios quienes se dedican a sus diferentes actividades económicas.  Ellos son Provenientes de una comunidad rural.
La coordinadora del grupo es Darling, de 30 años, casada y con dos hijos de 11 y 6 años de edad. ella se dedica a la compra y venta de frijoles al por menor quien lo comercializa en el mercado municipal desde hace 14 años. Con el préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de 22 quintales de frijoles crudo, para ofrecer a su variable clientela. Los demás integrantes del grupo son Ericka de 24 años, quien en su casa tiene su taller de costura. Y José de 35 años quien fabrica  manualmente canastos en su hogar desde 10 años e invertirá en la compra de bambú para ofrecer canastos decorativos y de calidad a su variable clientela.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Colibrí” is made up of three members who devote themselves to different economic activities. They come from a rural community.

The coordinator of the group is Darling. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children, ages 11 and 6. She has worked in buying and Retail sale of beans in the municipal market for the last 14 years. She will invest the loan into purchasing 22 quintals of raw beans to offer to her varied customers.

The other members of the group are Ericka, 24 years old, who has a sewing shop in her home; and José, 35 years old, who has made baskets by hand in his home for the last 10 years. He will invest in the purchase of bamboo to offer decorative baskets of good quality to his varied customers.

loans.use: to buy 22 quintals of beans.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa, 33, is married with five children, one who is in school. 

Marissa works very hard to provide for her children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for six years.

She has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, canned goods and chips.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, canned goods and chips.

loans.name: Tedi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Tedi, one of Ruma’s agents. Tedi lives in Sumedang, located in West Java, about 4-5 hours drive from Jakarta. He has one child.

Tedi owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides mobile payment services for his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago. He found out about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business in technology. 

As the business grows, Tedi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and electricity bill payment services to his community. It is important for you to know that your loan will be useful for Tedi's community, which needs access to such services. 

Tedi is shown in the photo. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, 48, is married with six children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years.

Gloria has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 28 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nadia operates a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years. 

Nadia requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional materials for her fishing business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Bibisora

texts.en:
Bibisora is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1957 and lives in a remote district. The place where she lives is well suited for agricultural work. She is married and has ten children.

She plants agricultural products in her yard and earns a good income from her activity. She is well known among friends and neighbors. She also knows her business well and has permanent customers for her harvest.

Bibisora needs to process and prepare her land for the next season. She appealed to IMON and Kiva, asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals, and seeds. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals, and seeds

loans.name: Annie Medaly

texts.es:
Annie tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ceviche, comida típica de la región, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 3 años por lo que cuenta con mucha experiencia y con clientela fija que da buenas referencias de ella. Solicita prestamo para la compra de una carpa para su negocio, con esto ella espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que va a tener un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Annie is 21 years old, is in a common-law relationship and lives in a family house in the rural area of the Oyotún district, in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Peru. The people of this district work in agriculture, commerce and raising animals. 

She works selling ceviche, a typical food of the region, and her business is located at her own house. She has been doing it for the last 3 years, gaining a lot of experience and a loyal clientele that gives good references of her. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a tent for her business. With this she hopes to give a better service to her customers and have a positive impact in her earnings, thus improving hers and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a tent for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Hede

texts.en:
Ma. Hede is 45 years old and has 6 children. She is married, and 3 of their children are currently in school.

Ma. Hede is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Hede has been fattening pigs for 11 years now, and she has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Hede would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en: A 40-year-old mother of three children, only one of whom is in school, Seam is a cassava and rice farmer living in Kampong Cham province. She has been involved in these businesses for twenty-two years and it earns her about 47,800 KHR per day. She is an existing client who has been with VisionFund for three cycles already and completely repaid the loans. The previous loans helped her to have enough household supplies to use and the ability to send her children to school. Due to a lack of funds, she is now applying for a loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pay the plowing and labor fee. She hopes this loan will help her expand her cassava farming and create a new business, rubber plant farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay the plowing and labor fee.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres De Negocio Group

texts.es: Duo Mujeres de Negocio La señora Gudelia quien se dedica desde hace mas de 20 años a la elaboración de pans y confección de cortinas solicita y pide que nuevamente se le brinde la oportunidad de obtener un crédito ya que ella necesita comprar tela para elaborar sus pans y sus cortinas y también invertir una parte de su crédito en la compra de sandalias ya que ella sale a distribuir y vender sus productos 2 veces por semana los lunes y martes ya que su anhelos es poder tener una pequeña fábrica y poder dejar de trabajar ya que no cuenta con otro ingresos es su único ingreso.
texts.en: The Mujeres de Negocio duo; Gudelia has worked for more than 20 years making sweatpants and sewing curtains and she asks for and requests that you again offer her the opportunity to get a loan since she needs to purchase fabric to make her sweatpants and her curtains and also to invest a part of the loan in the purchase of sandals. She goes out to distribute and sell her products 2 times per week on Mondays and Tuesdays and her desire is to be able to have a small factory and be able to stop working since she doesn't have another source of income and this is her only income.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make her sweatpants and her curtains, etc

loans.name: Marufahon

texts.en:
Marufahon is a strong woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in to a family of workers. She is widow and has grown children. For almost  40 years as she has been doing a business of traditional floral embroidery. She taught her children her skills. She has more than 50 students learning from her. 

Despite the fact that she is widow and it is hard for her to look after her family alone, she is confident and strong enough to feed her family. The source of her income is by sewing traditional floral embroidery. She wants to work efficiently and plans to buy a sewing machine. She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to make traditional floral embroidery

loans.name: Choquequirao Inc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO INC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rocio Mayveli ella es soltera y tiene 41 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.
Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agencia de viajes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Choquequirao Inc Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.  The member, Rocio Mayveli, is 41 years old and single.  She works in her handicrafts business and sells fabric, sweaters, blankets and looms; she sells different kind of woven.  She works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m.  She has been in this business for eight years and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her sales business of fabric and looms.

She's requesting the loan to buy fabric, sweaters and looms.

The other members work in clothing sales, handicrafts sales, a grocery store, and a travel agency.  The members who are attached to the group photo had permission to have their photo taken after the meeting because of work.

She's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this means and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sweaters and looms

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has been raising and selling hogs for more than 5 years now.  She is 37 year-old married woman with five year old daughter. Together with her family, she lives in Talibon, Bohol.  Her husband earns a living by being a driver. She needs capital to support her hog raising business. Aside from hog raising, she also engages in a food vending business. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP  is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and pig supplements. With these resources, she could now able to continue and handle her livelihood properly. In few months to come ,she will be able to sell quality hogs. In this way, her income would improve and able to handle her finances.

Marilyn is determined that someday her livelihood will become successful and she could also support the need of her young child.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and pig supplements to support her family

loans.name: Yorng's Group

texts.en:
Yorng lives in a rural village of the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 39 years old and married with three children; one is still too young for school. To support her family, she has been selling grocery items and sugarcane juice in front of her house.  The current business earns her about 55,000KHR per day to make a living and she can afford to save 27,000KHR each day after expenses. 

This is Yorng’s group second loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund and she has been with VisionFund for one cycle already. Now she is leading her group of three female members to apply for a loan. Yorng will use her portion to buy materials to reconstruct her old house. She hopes that this loan will help her to have a proper house for living in.

loans.use: to buy materials to reconstruct her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 55 years old, she is married, and she has 7 children.

Merlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell beauty products business in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy additional beauty products to resell.

Merlyn has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her buy-and-sell beauty products business for 7 years and also earns an income from her general store and raising pigs.

Merlyn aspires to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a welding machine for her husband's blacksmith shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a digital camera for her husband's photography business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a Babban Gona farmer from Bazana II Village. She joined Babban Gona so that she could realise better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Amina  no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed her family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see her increase her income considerably. This season Amina has ambitious plans to harvest 35 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Aminanow has the opportunity to move into a better home with her family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a proud United States Marine Veteran and loving husband and father of two children. After serving our country, he found work as an officer at a local hospital to support his family. Joseph hopes that one day he will be able to use the skills he has learned while serving our country to become a detective. Joseph is attempting to build his credit while supporting his wife and children, but he has been unable to obtain a credit score high enough to finance a few necessary repairs for the family's home.  The most urgent repair is replacing an inoperable air conditioning unit, which is very old and inefficient. Joseph and his family would greatly benefit from replacing the old unit as a new high efficiency air conditioner would improve the livability of the home for his children who are unable to stand living in a home that reaches temperatures over 100 degrees during these summer months. Joseph and his family will not only improve their quality of life and save money on energy bills, but Joseph's credit history will be positively affected as he repays his loan, which will help improve his credit score over time.

Joseph will use his Kiva loan to pay for a new high efficiency air conditioner that will improve the living environment for his children as well as help Joseph rebuild his credit.

loans.use: to purchase a new high efficiency air conditioner that will improve the living environment for his children as well as help Joseph rebuild his credit.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 54 years old and has five children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Rosita is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Rosita has been raising cattle for nine years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies to raise her cattle

loans.name: Silvana

texts.es:
Silvana es una madre joven, tiene una hija, está casada y quiero recibir el título de profesora bilingüe y luego ejercer mi profesión.
Ella lucha por su familia, para poder serles de apoyo y mejorar por medio de sus estudios. Quiere ser un ejemplo para su hija y es por ello que pone todo de sí para poder mejorar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo vine haciendo.
texts.en: Silvana is a young mother. She is married and has a daughter. She wants to get her degree as a bilingual teacher and then work in her profession. She is struggling for her family, to be able to help them and improve through her studies. She wants to be an example for her daughter and so she puts everything she has into each day to improve. She is requesting this loan to pay her course tuition and doing that be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Sheren

texts.en: Sheren is a 36-year-old married lady from Khan Younis city. Her husband works as an employee and earns a very low income. Sheren has a stall for selling soft drinks in the city. She provides her family with a very good income. Sheren took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more supplies for her soft drinks stall. Sheren appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her soft drinks stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent a shop in the main market for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa esta estudiando la carrera de Derecho, esta esforzándose para poder ser una buena abogada, esta luchando y esforzándose para poder lograrlo. Comenta que el préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en: Melissa is studying Law. She is making an effort to become a good lawyer. She is struggling and exerting herself to be able to achieve this. She comments that she used the previous loan to pay her university tuition which was a great help. She is requesting this new loan to once more pay her course tuition then she can continue to study as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Puerta Del Cielo Group

texts.es:
“Puerta del Cielo”, compuesto por 3 mujeres emprendedoras y dueñas de sus negocios, están con ADIM por 4ta. vez, solicitando crédito para mejoras y desarrollo de sus actividades comerciales. Gricela, de 46 años, acompañada y con un hijo de 13 años, ella es la líder del grupo, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y tiene una pulpería en su hogar.Con el crédito invertirá en la compra de arroz, aceite, gaseosas, además de perfumes y cremas para sus clientelas. Con los ingresos que obtendrá, desea ampliar más la pulpería, y realizar mejoras significativas en su hogar. 
Sus demás integrantes, María Alejandra, de 22 años, tiene una venta de condimentos e invertirá en productos como canela, manzanilla, algodones. Su sueño es crecer el negocio. Stefany de 23 años, es una joven emprendedora y requiere del préstamo para invertirlo en su tramo, del cual comprar juegos de trastes, mosquiteros, franelas y sabanas
texts.en:
"Puerta del Cielo," made up of three entrepreneurial women who own businesses, is with ADIM for the fourth time requesting a loan to improve and develop their commercial enterprises.  Gricela, who is 46, in a relationship, and has one son who is 13, is the leader of the group; she sells cosmetics and has a small grocery store in her home.  With this loan she will invest in rice, oil, and soft drinks, as well as perfumes and creams for her customers.  With the income she makes she wants to expand her small grocery store and make significant improvements to her home.  

The other members, María Alejandra, who is 22, has a stall where she sells spices and she will invest in products such as cinnamon, chamomile, and cotton.  Her dream is to expand her business.  Stefany, who is 23, is a young entrepreneur and she needs a loan to invest in her business so she can buy dish sets, mosquito nets, flannels, and blankets.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and soft drinks, as well as perfumes and creams for her customers.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 50 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Elsie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elsie has been farming sugarcane for 25 years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs and food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Barcelisa

texts.en:
Barcelisa is 69 years old, married, and has five children. She farms sugarcane in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years.

Barcelisa requested her twenty fourth loan from NWTF for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz está estudiando para poder ser una contadora publica, que pueda ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su conocimiento.
Ella es una persona muy luchadora que quiere ser alguien en la vida, y por medio de su profesión abrirse camino al mundo. Comenta que quiere poder ayudar a sus seres queridos, y es por ello que se esfuerza mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe cada día.
texts.en: Liz is studying to be a Public Accountant who can help others through her knowledge. She is very much a fighter who wants to be someone in life and through her profession open a path to the world. She comments that she would like to help her loved ones so she is exerting herself.  She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her university tuition so she can continue to study as she has been doing. She is grateful each day for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Manikeswari Group

texts.en:
Manikeswari Group was started in the year 2015 at Sihini village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are thirteen active self-dependent women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of this group have their own profession and business.

Arati is one of them and has taken a great role for her development and their group members’ livelihood improvement.
