She is standing in the second row, the third person from the left hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 32 years old and living with her small family, her husband and one child.

Arati has been engaged with an animal business (especially goats) in her own home at Sihini for the last ten years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the business. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR. Her opinion is that from this small income it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So, she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to avail herself of a loan for the expansion of her business.

Arati planned to purchase some goats from the wholesale market, rear them, and sell them at a higher rate. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business and save money for reconstruction of her house, and she wishes to enroll her son in a better school for education.

The other twelve members of the group are also smart at their professions and also are actively engaged with different professions like vegetable vending, milk business, stone cutting, paddy business, general store, and transport business, and with this loan, hope to boost up their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase some goats

loans.name: Sonia Mireya

texts.es: Sonia nació en 1964 en Metepec, Estado de México. Está casada desde hace casi 30 años y es madre de dos hijos. Sonia tiene un salario fijo gracias a su trabajo como analista en una institución del gobierno. Con la intención de tener mayores ganancias, inició un negocio vendiendo joyería, bolsas de mano y cosméticos a sus conocidos y amigos. A Sonia le gustaría abrir una boutique en la que pueda ofrecer todos sus productos y le permitiría aumentar su cartera de clientes, pero necesita capital para cumplir este sueño. Un préstamo de MXN 10,000 le ayudará a comprar joyería, maquillaje y accesorios de mujer en grandes cantidades para venderlos y ahorrar sus ganancias para arrancar con el proyecto de la boutique. Sonia es una mujer muy comprensiva que inició este negocio con la finalidad de ayudar a las personas a sentirse más felices al usar sus productos. Este es el primer préstamo de Sonia con Konfío y confía en sus habilidades financieras para estar a tiempo en las fechas de pago.
texts.en: Sonia was born in 1964 in Metepec, State of Mexico. She has been married for almost 30 years and is the mother of two children. Sonia has a fixed salary for her work as an analyst in a government institution. With the intention of having higher profits, she started a business selling jewelry, handbags and cosmetics to acquaintances and friends. Sonia would like to open a boutique to offer her products and increase her customer base but needs capital to fulfill this dream. A loan of MXN 10,000 will help her buy jewelry, makeup and accessories for women in large quantities to sell them and save her earnings to start her project of opening a boutique. Sonia is a very understanding woman who started this business in order to help people feel happier when using their products. This is Sonia's first loan with Konfío, and she trusts her financial skills to be on time on her payment dates.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, handbags, and cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Benny

texts.es: Una mujer muy trabajadora y apasionada en los negocios, Benny tiene 54 años, está casada y tiene un hijo. Ella ha vendido cosméticos, ropa, zapatos, productos dermo-cosméticos, joyería y productos veterinarios desde 2007. Como una mujer independiente, Benny siempre está buscando nuevas oportunidades para poder ofrecerles una mejor vida a su familia. Por esa razón, un préstamo de MXN 20,000 le ayudará a invertir en más productos dermo-cosméticos y veterinarios para abastecer su negocio. Ella será capaz de incrementar sus ventas para expandirse a otras regiones. Benny tiene un sueño: dejarle un legado a su hijo. Ella no está preocupada por los retos que se le puedan presentar en su camino hacia el éxito. Para continuar creciendo profesionalmente, Benny iniciará un curso de ventas en una institución en línea por los siguientes tres años. Está muy agradecida con todos los que la apoyan en este negocio. Este es el sexto préstamo de Benny con Konfío y siempre ha estado a tiempo en sus fechas de pago.
texts.en: A hardworking and passionate business woman, Benny is 54 years old, is married and has a son. She has sold cosmetics, clothing, shoes, skin cosmetics, jewelry and veterinary products since 2007. As an independent woman, Benny is always looking for new opportunities to provide a better life for her family. For that reason, a loan of MXN 20,000 will help her invest in skin cosmetics and veterinary products to supply her business. She will be able to increase her sales to expand to other regions. Benny has a dream: to leave a legacy to her son. She is not worried about the challenges that she may encounter on her way to success. To continue growing professionally, Benny will begin a sales course at an online institution for the next three years. She is very grateful to all who support this business. This is Benny's sixth loan with Konfío, and she has always been on time on her payment dates.

loans.use: to buy more skin cosmetics and veterinary products

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.  She earns additional income from fishing. 

Emie requested another loan from NWTF for 19,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional sacks of  feeds for her pig fattening business. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of  feeds

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvin es un joven de 20 años de edad, es soltero tiene una hija de un año, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de San Jorge La Laguna.
Marvin con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como jornalero y ayudante de albañil, gracias a esta labor ha sacado adelante a su familia.
Marvin ahora solicita un préstamo para poder comprar abono químico para el cultivo de cinco cuerdas de maíz, pues ahora su cultivo ya necesita de su abono químico y el en estos días no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder comprarlos por tal motivo solicita el préstamo 
El gran sueño de Marvin es que con esta cosecha logre buenas ganancias para poder construir su casa y darle a su familia un mejor hogar.
texts.en:
Marvin, aged 20, is single and has a one-year-old daughter. This humble family lives in a community in San Jorge La Laguna.

With the desire to earn an income and provide for his family, Marvin works as a day labourer and as a bricklayer's assistant. Through his work, he has been able to provide for his family.

Marvin is requesting the loan to buy chemical fertilizers for growing five cords of corn. To grow his crops, he needs chemical fertilizers, and these days he does not have enough capital to buy them.

Marvin's biggest dream is to make a good profit with this harvest so that he can build his house and give his family a better home.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his corn crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw material for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman and has nine school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a business buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and bricks and pay for labor.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is married and has five children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small jewelry shop, where he sells precious jewelry such as rings, earrings, bangles, and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case to attract customers.

Naseem's husband is the family's sole source of income; he has to pay the expenses of utility bills, school fees for his children, and household expenses. 

Naseem requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to buy precious jewelry, which will enable him to increase his earnings. She hopes to use the profits to fix her house so that her family members may pass their lives comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase artificial jewelry such as rings, earrings, bangles, and necklaces for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, milk, coffee, etc. for her general store business.

Sherlita has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from buying and selling rice and selling vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Sherlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elma works hard to support her family. She has a repair shop business in the Philippines and also earns income from farming rice.

Elma successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her repair shop business.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her repair shop

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
As a married parent with one child, Celia works hard to support her family. She has a business in which she buys and sells rice grains in the Philippines. She earns additional income from general store sales and raising pigs. Celia is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell as part of her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and has now requested another loan to further build her businesses. Celia has been sustaining her business activities through 18 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto es un joven proactivo, responsable y perseverante. Actualmente, estudia Contabilidad Pública y autoría, asimismo trabaja para apoyarse con los gastos académicos en un call center. Él sabe cuán importante es desarrollarse profesionalmente, pues esto le hará tener una mejor calidad de vida y así podrá formar una familia con bases sólidas. 

Por lo cual, solicita un crédito para pagar el curso de titulación ya que es el último requisito para obtener su título. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá iniciar su vida laboral en su área de trabajo, además de que podrá incrementar los ingresos económicos. Rigoberto se siente muy orgulloso de sí mismo porque esta aun paso de ser todo un profesional.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is a proactive, responsible, and persevering young man. He is currently studying Public Accounting and Auditing. He also works at a call center in order to support himself and pay his way through school. He knows how important it is to develop a professional career, because it will allow him to have a better quality of life and he will have a solid foundation to start a family one day.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan to pay for his final course, which is the last of the requirements he needs to meet in order to earn his degree. This will help him start his life as a professional, working in his field, and he will be able to increase his financial income. Rigoberto is very proud of his achievements, because he is but one step away from earning his degree.

loans.use: to pay for his degree.

loans.name: Mamata Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015 ten self-dependent women of Manigaon village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India formed a group named Mamata. The main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their social livelihoods by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Jashabanti is the most active and energetic lady of this village and has taken the leadership to form a self-help group. The lady is aged about 33 years. She is standing in the second row, the third person from the left hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and two children.

For the last six years, Jashabanti has been engaged with a vegetable vending shop with the help and support of her husband. She earns a monthly income of Rs. 4,800 from her occupation, but the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So, she decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business through a loan.

She will purchase a huge quantity of vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, cauliflower, chilies, potatoes, onion, garlic, ginger, cucumbers, apples, bananas, etc. as per demand of the customers from the nearest market. Through this, Jashabanti hopes that this will definitely generate a handsome amount of extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house.

The other nine members of the group are also engaged with different small businesses like packed snacks, pampad business, vegetable vending, milk selling, general store, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, cauliflower, chilies, potatoes, onion, garlic, ginger, cucumbers, apples, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Lovelle

texts.en:
She earns a living by means of fishing.  Her name is Lovelle, 28 years of age and a resident in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. In addition to that, she also engaged in hog raising business. She raises and sells hogs. 

She  is asking for a loan  to purchase fuel for the motor boat and pig feed. These will help boost its fishing livelihood and also improve the way she raises hogs. Thus, in few months to come, she will be raising quality hogs and start to augment her income. She could now start to pay her obligations and able to balance her earnings. 

She hopes that she could be successful in handling both her business for sustainable living.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for her motor boat and pig feed

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She does business buying and selling root-crops in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

Teresita industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming peanuts and raising livestock. She dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
Ma. Ana is 39 years old and is married with nine children. With six children in school, Ma. Ana works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. Ma. Ana has been in the general store business for five years, and she sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future, Ma. Ana would like to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Sun is 52-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are still in school. She is a rice farmer in the local area and supplements her family’s income by working as a paid worker. Having been in the business for 34 years, she can make daily income from her current business of 50,000KHR and is able to save about 20,000KHR per day after expenses for the future needs.

This is the first loan for Sun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her rice farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her rice farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a 47-year-old woman, living with her spouse and three children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw that he did not own. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. While it has a good engine, the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving the rickshaw but is looking for money to buy a rickshaw body and seat covers.

Thus, Ishrat has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and seat covers. This will allow him to drive the rickshaw smoothly. Ishrat hopes that her husband will be able to generate stable income once he does not have to pay a daily fair to anyone. She is very happy after receiving this loan, and she thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body and seat covers for her husband's transportation services business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to by natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 54 años de edad, vive en casa propia en una comunidad tranquila donde la gente se dedica al comercio, ganadería y agricultura, se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco a recorrido por las calles de Cayalti, Zaña y distritos cercanos, la venta la realiza en su mototaxi propia, se dedica a este negocio desde hace más de 10 años. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de pescado para su negocio, con esto el espera incrementar su nivel de ventas lo que le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is 54 years old. He lives in his own home in a peaceful community where people make their living in commerce, ranching, and agriculture. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Mario makes his living selling fresh fish on the streets of Cayalti, Zaña, and other nearby districts. He makes his sales in his own motorcycle taxi. He has been in this business for more than 10 years.

He will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of fish for his business. With this, he hopes to increase his level of sales, which will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of fish for his business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Betty industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs. She dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira, a hardworking entrepreneur, has operated a rice mill business in the Philippines for 10 years. She earns more income from running a general store and raising pigs.

Having repaid her previous loan, Elvira has requested a new one for PHP 40000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her rice mill. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF and dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill

loans.name: Yeimin Yulieth

texts.es: Yeimin de 28 años, inició su idea de negocio al pasar por una situación difícil, sin embargo demostró que existen muchas formas de generar recursos sin necesidad de tener un gran capital, ella laboro como operaría en unas confecciones de ropa en donde cancelaron su contrato hace dos años y angustiada por esta situación decidió invertir su liquidación en la compra de prendas de vestir y accesorios.  Esta entusiasta joven empezó ofrecer a sus vecinos, conocidos y amigos, los productos brindándoles cómodas cuotas para realizar sus pagos, contó con excelentes resultados, hoy en día ofrece una variada gama de productos por intermedio de catálogos de ropa infantil  y para cumplir con la entrega de unos pedidos está aplicando a su primer Credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los que comprará prendas de vestir, joyas en acero y demás encargos de sus clientes. Ella es madre de dos hijos por quienes desea mejorar sus ingresos para pagarles una mejor educación académica. Su meta de negocio es incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Yeimin is 28 years old. She decided to start her own business after going through some hard times, and she was able to prove that there are many ways to generate an income without having much capital. 

She used to work as a seamstress, but her company canceled her contract two years ago and, upset about her situation, she decided to invest her severance pay in the purchase of clothing and accessories. This enthusiastic young woman started offering these products to her friends, neighbors, and acquaintances. She also offered easy payment terms to them so that they could make payments on the items. The results were excellent.

Today she sells a wide variety of products through children's clothing catalogs, and in order to fulfill some pending orders, she is applying for her first Kiva  loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy clothing items, steel jewelry, and other items that her customers have ordered. 

She is a mother of two, and she wants to improve her income so that her children can have a better education. Her business goal is to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy clothing items, steel jewelry, and other items.

loans.name: Jeovanny Filimon

texts.es:
Jeovanny, de 32 años, estudio hasta octavo grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y tiene una hija de 4 años de edad. 

Jeovanny, es jornalero desde su adolescencia, actualmente trabaja en riego y en ocasiones en trabajos de corral, realizando ordeños y en mantenimiento de ganado.- Además, siembra 10,500 metros cuadrados a 45 minutos de su casa y viaja en motocicleta. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas específicamente abono, fertilizante y pesticidas, para que su cultivo crezca en buenas condiciones. 
 
El sueño que tiene Jeovanny, es seguir trabajando para que a su familia no le falte lo indispensable y espera darle la educación a  su hija en un par de años.
texts.en:
Jeovanny is 32 years old and he has an eighth grade education. He is in a relationship, his partner is a homemaker and they have a 4-year-old daughter.

Jeovanny has worked as a day laborer since adolescence. He currently does work in irrigation and sometimes farming, giving orders and maintaining the cattle. In addition, he has planted seeds on 10,500 square meters of land 45 minutes from his home, where he travels by motorcycle.

He needs the loan to buy farming supplies, specifically manure, fertilizer and pesticides so his crop grows in proper conditions.

Jeovanny's dream is to continue working so that his family has the essentials and he hopes to put his daughter in school in a couple of years.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, specifically manure, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a married woman and has eight school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her place of operation.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bazana II Village. Maryamu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. In the past, Maryamu suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to move into a better home with her family. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Maryamu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. 

This season, Maryamu has ambitious plans to harvest 40 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Maryamu now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields

loans.name: Mangala Group

texts.en:
Mangala Group was formed in the year 2015 at Turla village, of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are thirteen active, self-dependent women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of this group have their own profession and business.

Jajnaseni is one of them and has taken a great role for her development and their group members’ source of revenue improvement. She is standing in the second row, the third person from the right hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 30 years old and living with her small family, consisting of her husband and two children.

Her family has been engaged with a motorcycle and auto repairing business at Turla village for the last five years. As Jajnaseni says, through this business she earns a monthly income of 5,500 INR, and it is not sufficient to maintain her family, and hence there is almost zero surplus at the end of the month.

She planned to improve her business in the course of the loan, which resulted in taking the loan. She will purchase some mechanical stock and some modernized equipment from the nearest town. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for the purchase of a house and to provide better education to her children.

The other twelve members of her group are also smart at their professions and also are actively engaged with different businesses like vegetable vending, a milk business, popped rice business, paddy business, general store, and transport business. With this loan, they hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase some mechanical stock and some modernized equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand the area of her husband's green grocery shop.

loans.name: Cilmi Group

texts.en: Mohamoud is a 40-year-old man who lives in Gabiley, Somaliland. He is a responsible father of 13 children, six females and seven males, nine of whom go to school. Mohamoud is the one who is sitting in the middle of the group photo raising his hand. He owns a small shop in the Gabiley market. He has been running his small shop for the last three years. Mohamoud is the leader of group known as Cilmi which consists of Eight members, seven men and one woman. All the group members need to expand their medium and small businesses. Mohamoud  also wants to expand his small shop and he is requesting a loan of $500 from Kaaba Microfinance.

loans.use: To expand his  shop.

loans.name: Fransiscar

texts.en:
Fransiscar who is in her early 30’s, is married with three children, two are in school and one is still small.  She has been running two projects; running a salon and growing and selling chicken for four years now. 

This will be her 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy chicks and chicken feed and started the salon business and has managed to pay back all of her loans successfully.  She used the profits to pay her own school fees at the university, loan repayment and covered household expenses. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of her group.  She will use this loan buy up-to-date salon products and to buy chicks and chicken feed.  She dreams of becoming an international businesswoman.

Fransiscar will make sure she pays back her loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products and to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Marbeli Esperanza

texts.es:
La mercadotecnia es una carrera muy amplia, en la cual se tienen muchas posibilidades de desarrollarse profesionalmente. Marbeli está en su último universitario y confiesa ser amante de la mercadotécnica. Ella se siente muy orgullosa de todos los logros que ha obtenido en su vida, porque siempre su familia ha confiado y la  ha apoyado en todos sus sueños. 

Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para la compra de una computadora y para pagar los gastos de su tesis de graduación. Esto le será de gran ayuda porque podrá agilizar las investigaciones que necesita para su tesis, y finalizar sus estudios con éxitos. Marbeli, espera comenzar a trabajar cuanto antes, para apoyar en los gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
Marketing is a very broad field that has a lot of possibilities for professional development. Marbeli is in her last year of college and admits to loving marketing. She is very proud of her successes in life, because her family has always had faith in her and has supported her in all her dreams.

Nonetheless, she is applying for a loan to buy a computer and to pay for the costs of her graduation thesis. This will be of great help to her because she will be able to speed up the research that she needs for her thesis and successfully complete her studies. Marbeli hopes to start working as soon as possible in order to help with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a computer and to pay the costs of this thesis.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary, who is in her early 40s, is married with two children who are still in school. She has been selling lishe (a mixture of many products like rice, maize, wheat flour, beans, baking flour, etc.) for five years now. She works from 7am to 2pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rosemary's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her lishe stock and paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, make loan repayment and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy wheat flour, maize, baking flour, beans, ground nuts etc. to make a good mixture and meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of opening a mini-supermarket.

Rosemary will make sure she pays back her loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize, baking flour, beans, ground nuts.

loans.name: Juan Irene

texts.es:
Juan, a pesar de sus 67 años es un hombre proactivo y trabajador. Se dedica a la venta de Leche y a la sastrería, para apoyar la economía de su humilde hogar. Él se siente muy agradecido con Kiva porque a través de MiCrédito ha podido comprar materiales básicos para la producción de sus pequeños negocios, con el ultimo financiamiento pudo aumentar sus ganancias y ganó nuevos clientes. 

En esta ocasión, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar piedras canteras, cemento, hierro, arena. Para mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, pues esto le será de gran ayuda porque podrá tener mayor espacio para trabajar, así como mejorará las condiciones de vida de él y su familia.  Juan planea ahorrar las ganancias que obtenga para vivir cómodo en su vejez.
texts.en:
Juan is 67 years old, but he is still proactive and hardworking. He works as a tailor and also sells milk. This allows him to support his humble household. He is very grateful to Kiva because MiCrédito has allowed him to be able to buy the basic materials he needs in order to keeps his small businesses going. The last financing he received allowed him to increase his profit and reach new customers.

This time he is requesting a new loan to buy quarry stones, cement, iron, and sand to improve his home infrastructure. This will be of great help to him because he will have more working space and improve his and his family's living conditions. 

Juan plans to save the money from the profit he makes so that he can live comfortably when he reaches old age.

loans.use: to buy quarry stones, cement, iron, and sand.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman and has five school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Jarlin

texts.es:
Jarling es un padre responsable, trabajador y emprendedor. Desde hace unos años, inició ofreciendo  los servicios de molino. Y gracias a los financiamientos de MiCrédito ha podido mejorar las condiciones de trabajo, con el último crédito pudo darle mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo, optimizando la producción y ganancias. 

En esta ocasión, solicita un nuevo crédito para la comprar huevos, esto le será de ayuda porque podrá ofrecer este producto a sus clientes que lo han estado demandando últimamente. Jarling planea continuar trabajando con MiCrédito para ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jarling is a responsible, hardworking and entrepreneurial father. For the past few years he has been running a mill. Thanks to the MiCrédito loans, he has been able to improve his working conditions; with the last loan he was able to maintain his tools, optimizing production and profits.

On this occasion, Jarling is requesting a new loan to buy eggs, which will be helpful because he will be able to offer this product to his customers who have been requesting them lately. Jarling also plans to continue working with MiCrédito to expand his home.

loans.use: to buy eggs.

loans.name: Norlan Antonio

texts.es:
Norlan tiene muchos años de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz y frijoles, aunque no es un trabajo fácil, confiesa sentirse contento de dedicarse a ello, pues con las ganancias ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Él se siente agradecido con MiCrédito porque gracias al último financiamiento que esta microfinanciera le brindó, pudo realizar una buena siembra y obtener jugosas ganancias de ella. 

En esta ocasión, solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de abono, asimismo para alquilar tierras donde sembrar y para contratar ayudantes. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá prepararse para su próxima cosecha, con lo cual incrementará sus ganancias. Norlan planea continuar trabajando con MiCrédito para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Norlan has devoted many years to growing corn and beans. Although it is not an easy job, he admits he is happy to pursue it because he has been able to use his profits to get his family ahead. He is grateful to MiCrédito because, thanks to his last loan, he was able to make a good harvest and get huge profits from it.

On this occasion, he is requesting a new loan to purchase fertilizer, to rent land to plant on, and to hire assistant workers. This will be helpful because he can prepare for his next harvest, which will increase his profits. Norlan plans to continue working with MiCrédito to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rent land to plant on, and hire workers.

loans.name: Peace-Shadom Group

texts.en: The 'in God' Group consists of two members who live in Teshie, Accra-Ghana. They have applied for a loan of GHS 3,800 from ID-Ghana to invest in tiles, cement, rice, pure water, cooking utensils and detergents. Charles is a 40-year-old married man with two children who lives in Teshie, Accra-Ghana. He is the featured borrower. He has been selling detergents, palm and kennel oil, gari (cassava flour) and maize for 12 years. Currently, he wants to buy more tiles and cement to sell to customers, but he doesn't have enough capital. He decided to apply for a loan of GHS 1,800 from ID-Ghana in order to purchase more tiles and cement to sell to customers. He looks forward to improving his business. Together with the colleague they will need a total amount of GHS 2,800 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more tiles and cement to sell to customers.

loans.name: Milgian Noemy

texts.es:
Milgian, de 35 años de edad, ha tenido una vida dura, pues tuvo que cuidar de sus hermanos desde muy corta edad, sin embargo, logro estudiar hasta bachillerato; posteriormente se casó, pero las cosas no salieron bien y se divorció, actualmente tiene un compañero de vida, el cual se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, tiene 3 hijos de su primer matrimonio, los cuales tiene que cuidar y mantener.

Milgian, tiene una tienda en su casa, en donde vende desde productos básicos para el hogar, hasta golosinas, ya tiene 10 años de tener la tienda y sus hijos le ayudan por las tardes a atenderlas 

Milgian, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería, y así suplir con la demanda de los clientes, que cada dia va creciendo más, por el buen trato que reciben.

Milgian, sueña con llegar a tener un comedor, para irse superando y así gozar de una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos; también aspira con que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales y personas de bien.
texts.en:
Milgian is 35 years old. She has had a hard life as she had to take care of her siblings from a young age. However she manged to finish Secondary school. Later she got married but things did not go well and she got divorced. She now has a life companion who works driving taxi. She has three children from her first marriage who she has to care for and support.

Milgian has a store in her house where she sells basic food items to sweets. She has had the store for 10 years and her children help her in the afternoons serving the clients.

Milgian needs a loan to buy more merchandise and supply the demand from her clients which increase daily due to the good treatment they get.

Milgian dreams of having a cafe in order to get ahead and be able to have a better quality of living for her children. She also hopes that her children become professionals and good people.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Sidra's Group

texts.en:
Sidra is 28 years old. She lives with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running a mobile phone shop for eight years and is generating sufficient income. He troubleshoots mobile phones, sells mobile accessories such as chargers, bodies, data cable, etc., and provides the recharge facilities of different networks.

Nowadays demand for accessories and for recharge has increased a lot, and sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest in his business because he has already spent all of his savings on household expenses.

Therefore, Sidra has requested a loan for her husband so that he can be empowered to buy additional accessories and extra credit for his recharge facility. Sidra thanks Kiva and its field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy mobile accessories and extra credit for her husband's mobile shop.

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is a married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 19 and the youngest is 5. She is involved in farming, growing and selling rice. In addition to that, she also operates a motorcycle transport service. She earns an income out of the rent from it.  The client is standing in front of her farm, and the it shows that she has already harvested her yield which is rice, thus the background shows only the stalks of the rice left. 

She is asking for a loan to buy tires and oil for her motorcycle. These tools would help improve the operation of her transportation services as well as passenger's safety. Thus, it helps augment her earnings and able to pay her obligations. With these, she will be able to prepare healthy foods for the whole family.

Cresilda hopes that someday, she will be successful in handling her business to be able  to continue send all her children to school for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy tires and oil for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza, 38, is married and has five children ranging in age from 21 down to five years. For the past ten years she has farmed and sold ampalaya, also known as bitter gourd. 

Liza has applied for a 7,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy additional seedlings and medicines for the farm like pesticides. These materials will help improve her farmland and lead to a better harvest. Thus, her earnings will increase and help her handle her finances.

Liza is determined to manage her income sources well, become successful and support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings and medicines

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol is 66 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Sol runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

Sol has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, personal care products and other groceries. 

In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rolaina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rolaina works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store, raisng pigs and selling wood. 

Rolaina is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell for her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Rolaina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Merejoy

texts.en:
As a  parent of three children, Merejoy works hard to support her family. She has a farming rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and food vending.  

Merejoy is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her farming rice business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Merejoy has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Ellen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ellen has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman and has four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows to sell

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
El cultivo de maíz, frijoles y trigo es la principal actividad económica de José de 50 años. Este hombre laborioso y emprendedor, se siente agradecido con MiCrédito porque con el último financiamiento que hizo  pudo comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para sembrar su cosecha pasada, también pudo contratar ayudantes que lo apoyaron a hacer una huerta.
 
En esta ocasión solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de semillas de frijoles, comprar de abono y adquirir un terreno para fertilizar maíz. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá hacer una buena siembra y en consiguiente, podrá obtener jugosas ganancias. José planea seguir trabajando con MiCrédito para invertir en sus tierras.
texts.en:
Growing corn, beans, and wheat is the main business activity of José, 50. This hardworking, enterprising man is grateful to MiCrédito because with his previous loan, he was able to buy the necessary agricultural supplies to plant his past harvest. He was also able to contract helpers who supported him to make a vegetable garden.

He is now applying for a new loan to buy bean seeds, fertilizer, and to acquire a plot of land to fertilize corn. This will help him because he will be able to have a good seeding and later earn lucrative profits. José plans to continue working with MiCrédito to invest in his land.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, fertilizer, and acquire a plot of land to fertilize corn.

loans.name: Diana María

texts.es:
Diana es una persona emprendedora, trabajadora, una mujer que lucha por su familia, se dedica a tender un salón de belleza el cual monto con la esperanza e ilusión de darle una excelente calidad de vida a su familia, conformada por su pareja que le ayuda con ingresos y su hija de 14 años de edad que actualmente están cursando en la escuela.

Pagar la educación de sus hijos es su obsesión, mejorar el local y hacerlo llamativo es su prioridad en el momento.

Diana quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, quiere comprar una vitrina, surtido de productos de cuidado capilar, pintar su negocio y comprar implementos, comprar muebles, sillas, y suscribirse a una revista para que sus clientes tengan algo para leer mientras esperan su turno.
texts.en:
Diana is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman who fights for her family. She makes a living tending a beauty salon, which she built with the hope and anticipation of providing her family with an excellent quality of life. She lives with her partner, who helps with household income, and her 14 year old daughter who is currently enrolled in school.

Paying for her children’s education is her obsession, and improving her store to make it appealing is her priority at the moment.

Diana wants to take out a loan to invest in her business: she wants to buy a display case, assorted hair care products, paint her business and buy tools, furniture, chairs, and subscribe to a magazine so that customers have something to read while waiting their turn.

loans.use: to buy furniture, chairs, and a magazine subscription for her clients while they wait at her beauty salon.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is very thankful to KIVA for the loan granted to her in the amount of PhP 50,000 which she used to buy 10 sacks of dried anchovies and three sacks of dried shrimps to be delivered to her customers. Analiza's business is doing well, so she was able to repay the loan quickly. The revenue resulting from the loan has helped her with the family's daily expenses and savings for their future.

Analiza's home recently burned down, but her business was spared and she was able to rebuild her home. To help her community she hired two neighbors who were also fire victims to repack and deliver her shrimp and dried fish.

Analiza now is delivering to a wider area and is currently renting a vehicle to deliver her goods. She is requesting a loan of PhP 100,000 to buy a second-hand vehicle to help deliver her goods to her customers. The vehicle will help her to save money from costly rental and driver fees. 

Analiza is confident that the loan will help her save time and money and increase her income; in the near future she will be able to offer consignment to her neighbors so they can earn extra income.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand delivery vehicle to deliver her goods to her customers

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en: Navy, 51, is a mother of two, living in Battambang province. She has been a scrap recycling paper contractor for seven years and it earns her about 91,300KHR per day to support her family’s living. Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group of two to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to increase her inventory. She hopes to earn more income and expand her current business through this loan.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Native products or native crafts in the Philippines do not only give profits to local manufacturers, but it also showcases Filipinos’ ingenuity and gives value to indigenous people’s arts and culture. Teresita knows of its importance; that is why she chose to venture in this kind of business. She operates a store of native products located in one of the markets in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. The store sells items created from coconut shells or husks, rattan, sea shells, bamboo, dried leaves and stems, woven ethnic threads, and many others. These hand-made objects are very attractive to foreigners and local tourists who usually visit the area.

Teresita would like to add more selection of native products that will surely entice the buyers. She is in need of Php 25,000 additional capital to procure these. Hope you are willing to help her so she can increase her profit, sustain their everyday needs, and boost her savings.

Teresita is married to Emilio, who is always supportive of her and her business. They have children and grandchildren to whom they want to bestow all their undertakings. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy an additional selection of native products and crafts

loans.name: Flordiluna

texts.en:
Flordiluna resides in Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta, and she is a widow. She joined PMPC in May of 2009, in order to access the programs and services of the cooperative. 

Recently, she's accessing another loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 for additional working capital to buy a variety of goods for her business, which is selling a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods to sell at her general store.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a businesswoman from Liloy and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari (general) store and earns a good income. This is how she helps support her husband who provides income for their living. 

Marciana is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without record of default. Now, she's accessing her fifth loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Marciana continues to look for better business opportunities and hopes to have a stable financial status to benefit her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 53 years old and married with six children.  With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Luisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander un hombre de 39 años de edad, una persona muy trabajadora, emprendedora que trabajo muchos años en una empresa de prefabricados aprendiendo de la labor, ganaba un salario ordinario que le alcanzaba para pagar sus deudas y nada más.

Un día cualquiera Alexander quiso romper su rutina y aspirar a una mejor vida, ya tenía un hijo y se preguntaba si el estilo de vida que llevaba podría ser suficiente para sostenerse en un futuro, agobiado por la incertidumbre tomo el riesgo de emprender su nuevo negocio ayudado de la experiencia que obtuvo en su trabajo.

Hoy en día Alexander tiene su negocio, genera un empleo se está haciendo un espacio en el mercado y se siente feliz pro la decisión que tomo pues la vida de su familia es mucho mejor ahora.

En vista de mejorar sus ventas, realizar otros pedidos, ampliar la carta de oferta en su negocio Alexander quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos en yeso, y otro materiales y moldes para prefabricar tejados, adobes, estructuras entre otros. 

Este préstamo el ayudara a abrirse a mayor número de mercados algo estupendo para su labor.
texts.en:
Alexander, 39, is a very hardworking, enterprising person who worked for many years in a precasting company, learning about this work. He earned a normal salary which allowed him to pay off his debt and nothing more. 

One day, Alexander wanted to break his routine and aspire towards a better life. He already had a child and wondered if his lifestyle would be enough to sustain himself in the future. Overwhelmed by uncertainty, he took the risk of starting his new business, helped by the experience he had from his job.

Today, Alexander has his business and generates employment. He is making a space in the market and he is happy with the decision he made, because his family's life is much better now.

With the goal of improving his sales, fulfilling other orders, and expanding the offers of his business, Alexander would like to apply for a loan to buy plaster supplies and other materials and molds to precast roofs, adobe bricks, and structures, among others.

This loan will help him to open himself to a greater number of markets, which is wonderful for his work.

loans.use: to buy plaster supplies and other materials and molds to make roofs, adobe bricks, and structures, among others.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with two children, ages 15 and 24 years old. 

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like  seasonings, hard drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, sanitary napkins, cooking oil, biscuits and many others.  Her husband also has a small business which will help them to meet their daily needs.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted stocks for the store and RTW (ready-to wear clothes). These will boost its stocks and enable customers to buy more. Thus, her income will slowly improve. In this way, she will be able to pay her obligations and handle her finances. 

In the future, Leonila hopes that she will be able to manage her sari-sari store business productively and continue to finance the schooling of her younger child.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks for the store and RTW (ready-to wear)

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
Fedila is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Fedila is 44 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Fedila has a fishing business in the Philippines. Fedila requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Fedila has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Fedila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan will be used to buy and build an electric pump at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build an electric pump for their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Yanet Cecilia

texts.es:
Yanet junto a su esposo atiende un negocio de tienda de abarrotes, una actividad que iniciaron por gusto al trabajo independiente y en el cual han encontrado una buena estabilidad económica, darle a su hija todo lo que necesita, estudio, ropa, vivienda, un techo y una familia amorosa, ellos no tienen artilugios, grandes comodidades pero tienen lo indispensable para vivir y se ganan las cosas con trabajo humilde. 

Yanet junto a su esposa trabajan 15 horas dividas en dos turnos, gracias a este extenso horario se gana el capital suficiente para pagar sus deudas.

Yanet quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes, granos, productos de aseo doméstico, la solicitud la hace para abastecer sui negocio y tener mayor inventario, busca la sostenibilidad y el aumento de ventas a través de nuevas marcas y la inclusión de productos nuevos como escobas, trapeadoras, desodorantes y accesorios.
texts.en:
Yanet has a grocery store along with her husband. They started this business activity because they liked independent work, and in this business they have found good financial stability. They can give their daughter everything she needs, studies, clothing, a home, a roof and a loving family. They do not have gadgets or great comforts, but they have what they need to live and they earn things with humble work.

Yanet and her husband work for 15 hours, divided into two shifts. Thanks to this extensive schedule, they earn sufficient capital to pay off their debts.

Yanet would like to apply for a loan to buy groceries, grains, and domestic cleaning products. She is making this application in order to stock her business and have a greater inventory, looking for greater sustainability and an increase in sales through new brands and the inclusion of new products such as brooms, mops, deodorants and accessories.

loans.use: to buy groceries, grains, and domestic cleaning products.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a 36 year old married woman. She lives with her husband and four children. She and her husband cooperates together in order to fulfill their lifestyle and needs. She has been working in the agriculture sector, for the past ten years, in order to earn extra income and be able to support her family financially. 

Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase seeds and seedlings for plantings in order to expand her business and being able to cultivates more vegetables and fruits to increase her productivity and her income. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. She is certain that with the new merchandises, she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and seedlings for plantings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to use for farming

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 29 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. 

She is in the agricultural business farming banana in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Marites has been farming banana for three years and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Eam's Group

texts.en:
Eam, 58, lives with her husband and eight children in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Only one of her total children is still in school. She has struggled to feed and care her children by farming rice on one-hectare farmland which she has been in the business for 40 years while her husband works for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about 55,000KHR per day and manage to save about 20,000KHR each day for the future.
 
Eam is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for alone to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and earn more healthy crops to make a living better and keep her kid in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her rice farmland and for her children's education and a better living for the family

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Hoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province, Hoeurn is 44 years old and married. She has five dependent children. The primary source of her family’s income is from rice farming. Having been in this business for 26 years, she can earn about 50,000KHR per day and manage to save about 20,000KHR each day after the expenses. 

Hoeurn is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan in order to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent hose for living in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house so that it is better to live in

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for her barn.

loans.name: Sonia Maribe

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 42 años de edad ella tiene un negocio de café internet, es casada y tiene una hija de 2’ años de edad que depende económica de ella.

Sonia en su negocio genera un empleo el movimiento de alquiler de equipos es bueno, pero siente que a su negocio le falta algo, en el momento solo cuenta con el servicio de café internet y quiere implementarle venta de papelería, fotocopiado, escáner, para complementar su s servicios.

Sonia quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar una impresora multifuncional, comprar surtido de útiles escolares e insumos de papelería.

Este préstamo el ayudara a capitalizarse, tiene runa línea de venta nueva y generar más recursos con los cuales piensa comprar por cuotas una vivienda propia o por lo menos ese es sueño.
texts.en:
Sonia is 42 years old and has an Internet café. She is married and has a two-year-old daughter who depends on her financially.

Sonia provides a job to another person at her business. Sonia’s Internet café is doing well but she feels that something is missing: currently Sonia only offers Internet services but she also wants to sell stationery, and provide photocopying and scanning services to complement her services.

Sonia is applying for a loan in order to buy a multifunctional printer and to buy stock in the form of school supplies and stationery.

This loan will provide Sonia with capital and give her a new line of products to sell in order to earn a higher income. Sonia is thinking about investing this added income in a house that she can buy in instalments; this is her dream, at least.

loans.use: to buy a multifunctional printer and to buy stock in the form of school supplies and stationery.

loans.name: Gildardo De Jesus

texts.es:
Cada persona tiene su forma de trabajar, la de Gildardo es salir a empujar diariamente su carro de supermercados cargado de productos acolchados, sabanas, almohadas, tendidos, cortinas, Gildardo es un hombre soltero que no tiene hijos su profesión es la única que genera sustento para pagar sus deudas.

Inicio su vocación pro gusto al trabajo independiente, aprendió solo y lo hace por un objetivo que es comprar una vivienda propia ese sueño que lo hace levantar cada día a dar lo mejor de sí.

Gildardo solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido, (cobijas, tendidos, cortinas) y así como lo viene haciendo, salir y gritar en la calle que vende sus productos siempre con el ánimo y entusiasmo que caracteriza a esta persona.
texts.en:
Everyone has their own way of working. Gildardo’s is to go out every day and push his supermarket trolley filled with quilts, bedsheets, pillows and curtains. Gildardo is single and has no children. His work is his only source of income for paying debts.

Gildardo started his business as he likes to work independently. He learned his trade alone, and is doing it in order to buy his own home. This dream is what gets him up every morning to give the best that he has.

Gildardo is applying for a loan in order to buy stock (blankets, curtains and bedclothes) and to continue going out to the streets and shouting about his products with the enthusiasm and motivation that defines him.

loans.use: to buy stock (blankets, curtains and bedclothes).

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 56 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her needs.

Nida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, personal care products and other groceries.

Nida has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Xiaobing

texts.en:
Xiaobing is a 27 years old man who was opened a haircut shop more than ten years. When he was a teenager he devotes himself into society . He begins to learn haircut skills in Guangzhou Province when he left school. 
He is very smart and hardworking so that he uses a less time but learns more professional skills. Five years ago, with the help of his wife, he opened a haircut shop. At the beginning, his business runs very hard for they haven’t enough relationship to bring enough customers. He feels a little desperate. His wife encourages him to use the extra time to do marketing. The result is effective, there are a lots of customers come soon. 
Last year, his wife is pregnant. In order to take care of his two children and his parents, he back to his hometown and opens a haircut shop again. Facing with the pressure of raising two children and their parents, and also they finished the house decoration which cost large amount of money. He requested ￥15,000RMB in Microcred. He told us he will use part of the money for their haircut shop, for he need to buy more perm lotions materials and devices, also he need to buy all kinds of shampoo for meeting clients demands. He hopes that he will earn enough money to open a cloth store for his wife.
He believes that they could have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more perm lotions materials and shampoo

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 29 years old, married, and has one child that attends school.  She lives in the Philippines and has operated an agricultural business fattening pigs for the past 6 years. 

Jessica requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.  She has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jessica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Seonilyn

texts.en:
Seonilyn is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her motorcycle transport.

Seonilyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 52-year-old woman living in a small area of Lahore with her three children and a husband. Her husband used to work in a factory before he retired. Right after his retirement, he started a jewellery shop in a very popular bazaar far from his residence.But after a crisis situation, he lost all the savings and now has nothing to buy inventory for reselling with. As his choice is very popular and the demand is high for is products, Nasreen therefore applied for the loan and is very thankful to KIVA team and its field partner BRAC.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for her husband.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
God continually molds the people who are willing to submit to His tending hands. Rowena learned to give up her former unpleasant lifestyle through the guidance of God and her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. She managed to turn her old habits into productive ways of income generation. She now has three businesses: a variety store that provides commodities in the community, a direct sales business of cosmetics, clothes, shoes and bags, and a hog fattening venture. She can manage all these with the help of her supportive partner, Arlo, a construction worker. They have children whom they love so much, the source of their inspiration. They live in Talisay City, Negros Occidental.

Rowena normally experiences stiff competition in business, but she focuses on her goal to sustain the family's everyday expenses, provide for the educational needs of their children, and expand her businesses. She’s looking forward to the completion of their children’s education that will give them better lives in the future.

Rowena aspires to have additional capital of PHP 40,000 for her small enterprises so she can gain extra profit and savings. As much as possible, she desires to prepare early for the future so that her children won’t experience her former unpleasant life.  
 
Rowena regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her variety store

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Arlene is 46 years old and has one child in school.

Arlene has a general store business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for two years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marinel

texts.en: Marinel, 48 years old, is married and has seven children, three of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past three years, Marinel has operated a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. In the future, Marinel would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school.  She lives in a house that has electricity but no piped water.

Selina has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.  She faces a major challenge of theft and seasonality in her place of operations.
 
With the loan, Selina is requesting a loan to purchase additional stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en: Maria Luz  is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 8 years, she has operated a business buying and selling root crops in the Philippines. Maria Luz has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of root crops to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of root crops to sell

loans.name: Samara

texts.ru: Самара, 26 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, с 2010 года занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы. На 1,0 Га выращивает кукурузу для реализации. Ее ежемесячная совокупная прибыль от бизнеса составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). Самара решила развить ее бизнес, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Samara is 26 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has a secondary education. She has been farming since 2010. She has four cows. She grows corn for sale on one hectare of land. Her gross monthly profit from the business is 17,000 som (KGS). Samara has decided to develop her business, so she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock. She will direct the proceeds of the loan towards the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock to increase her herd.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco, 72 years old, is married and has eight children. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past eleven years, Francisco has operated a general store business in the Philippines. He has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as canned goods, noodles and personal care products. In the future, Francisco would like to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as canned goods, noodles and personal care products.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en: Girlie, 45 years old, is married and has four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past two years, Girlie has operated a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. In the future, Girlie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Violeta successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. 

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college and to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 54 years old, single, and works very hard to provide for herself.

Alicia has operated a general store in the Philippines for 5 years, selling a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries.  She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

In the future Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis Fernando es un trabajador de cale de 30 años de edad, se sitúa en eventos, ferias, reuniones, manifestaciones, tablados que hay en las calles de la ciudad en un mantel llevando unas canecas llenas de hielo que alberga sus productos (cervezas, agua, aguardiente y ron).

Con el negocio mantiene a su familia, su señora madre, su pareja, su sueño es poder montar un bar, un negocio con música, donde personas disfruten compartir una buena cerveza y trabajara fuerte para lograrlo.

Luis quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de bebidas, cervezas, aguardiente, ron y comprar una carreta para transportar más fácil sus productos.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando is 30 years old, a street vendor who stations himself at events that take place in the streets of the city, such as street markets, meetings, demonstrations, performances.  He keeps his products (beer, water, whisky and rum) on a cloth bearing ice-filled containers.

He supports his family (his mother and his partner) with his business. His dream is to be able to set up a bar, a business with music where people can enjoy sharing a good beer, and he will work hard to achieve it.

Luis wants to apply for a loan so that he can buy drinks, beer, whiskey and rum, and buy a cart for transporting his products more easily.

loans.use: To buy drinks, beer, whiskey, rum, and buy a cart for transporting his products more easily.

loans.name: Yulduzhon

texts.en:
Yulduzhon is a cheerful woman who was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1986. She lives in a remote district where conditions for agricultural businesses are good. Yulduzhon is a widow and has no children. She had a business keeping and selling livestock. To gain additional income, she started to plant agricultural products in her yard.
