Her brothers and sisters help her with the business. 

Yulduzhon likes her activity and wants to gain a good harvest. She is planning to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals and seeds to process her land for plantings. She asked for a loan from KIVA to buy these items. She hopes to be supported and to continue her activity in order to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals and seeds

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita, 49 years old, is married and has five children. She has an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucita has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lucita has been raising pigs for six years, and has previously borrowed 8 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Lucita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 61 years old, and widowed with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elena has a general store business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Elena has been in this business for five years. In the future, Elena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
A 29-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school, Emily is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has been operating a fishing business in the Philippines for six years now.

Emily has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Damian Alberto

texts.es:
23 años es la edad de este sorprendente joven llamado Damián  que a su corta edad ya tiene un taller de mecánica donde genera dos empleos, las ganas de trabajar y de apoyar a su madre lo llevaron al emprendimiento y toda la maquinaria, los empleos que genera los ha logrado en tan solo un año de operación un verdadero logro para una persona nacida en una familia humilde pero con mente ganadora. 

Damián quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar una maquinaria que no tiene la cuales s un compresor para pintar vehículos, inflar llantas y un soldador valga la redundancia para soldar partes metálicas. 

Este préstamo le ayudara a conseguir una maquinaria que anteriormente alquilaba el equipo.
texts.en:
23 years old is the age of this surprising young man called Damián, who despite his age already has a mechanical workshop where he has two jobs. His desire to work and the need to support his mother lead to his entrepreneurship and need for the machinery. 

The jobs and work which he has carried out in only 1 year are a real achievement for a person born in a humble family, however he has a winning mentality. 

Damián would like to ask for a loan to purchase machinery which he does not have at the moment, a compressor to paint vehicles and inflate tyres and a worthwhile welding iron to weld metal parts.

This loan will help him to get a machine that he was previously renting.

loans.use: to buy a compressor to paint vehicles, inflate tyres and a worthwhile welding iron to weld metallic parts

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Chhon and his wife are farmers with 3 dependent children living in Vannak village, which is far from the power grid. Over the past 10 years, Chhon has expanded his farming business from a small amount of land to a big 3-hectare cassava farm. Chhon devotes himself to enhancing his business and his family's living conditions. He wants his family to live comfortably; however, energy off the power grid area is one of his concerns. 

Chhon's house has no reliable energy source. He has to go to charge the car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. He also wants to save more money on utility fees. Chhon has to spend time and money on the car battery everyday, which disturbs not only his working time but also his family's condition.  As a result, Chhon is applying for a KIVA loan to buy high quality home solar energy. He believes this will make his family's living conditions better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Vattanak Village, Vattanak Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a married woman with three children. She is 41 years old and all three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Juvy has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Juvy requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Juvy would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Fifty-one year old Yolanda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities ranging from canned goods, biscuits, beverages, condiments, soap and vegetables. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman with four grown children. She needs additional capital to sustain her source of living.

Yolanda has requested a loan to buy stocks of assorted goods like canned goods, clothing and snack foods such as chips. It could help her to improve the contents of her store and be able to attract buyers to come. Thus, enabling her to augment her livelihood. With these improvements, she will be able to settle her obligations and handle her finances.

With the resources available, she is determined to properly handle her sari-sari (variety) store business for the improvement of the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stocks of assorted goods like canned goods, clothing and snack foods such as chips.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a fishing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosalie dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora, a 55-year-old married mother of four, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has been operating a fishing business in the Philippines for eight years now. 

Leonora has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Vivi Sandra

texts.en:
Vivi Sandra is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell root crops business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell.

Vivi Sandra has been in this business for five years. Vivi Sandra earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses. 

Vivi Sandra has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell

loans.name: Yolly

texts.en:
Yolly is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from raising livestock. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Yolly dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Aura Maria

texts.es:
Aura es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, capaz, ella monto un negocio de tienda de abarrotes con sus habilidades de mercadeo que aprendió empíricamente, trabaja junto con su pareja para tratar de tener abierta la tienda el mayor tiempo posible.

Aura es madre de dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad, su propósito es mantener a esos muchachos, darles una buena educación, techo, vestimenta en un futuro poder pagarle la educación, todo ayudado de su tienda que piensa y sueña que en algún momento crezca y se convierta en un mini mercado.

Aura quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual desea invertir para el crecimiento de su empresa, comprara un enfriador con lo que podrá albergar mayor cantidad de productos refrigerados como leche, refrescos, carnes frías, entre otros y el resto de capital lo invertirá para abastecer su negocio
texts.en:
Aura is a woman who is hard-working, enterprising, and capable. She started a grocery store business with the marketing skills that she learned through experience. She works with her spouse to try to have the store open for the greatest amount of time possible.

Aura is the mother of two children, ages eight and five. Her intentions are to provide for these kids, give them a good education, a roof over their heads, clothing, and be able to pay for education in the future—all with the help of her store, which she thinks and dreams about developing into a mini market someday. 

Aura wants to request a loan in order to invest in growing her business. She will purchase a refrigerator with which she will be able to stock a greater quantity of refrigerated products, such as milk, soft drinks, cold meats, and other items. She will invest the rest of the capital in stocking her business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, and supplies such as milk, soft drinks, cold meats, and other items.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Filipinos are known to be resilient and tough. Comparable to bamboo trees, they are bent but not broken. They also gather strength through togetherness and camaraderie. This is the exact description of how Helen was able to recover and rehabilitate her business. 

She is from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, and she sells fresh and dried fish, fruits, and ready-to-wear clothes. Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013 resulted in the dwindling of her business, but she gradually restored it with the unwavering support of Jessen, her husband, and their children. Her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative also contributed a lot through their inspiring stories and Bible reflections.

As she continues to develop her business, she needs additional capital of 25,000 PHP to obtain more stock and increase her buying power in the approaching rainy season, when fish will be scarce and expensive. She aims to get a permanent space in the public market so customers can easily locate her. Due to her age, she can hardly transfer from one rented space to another. Your generous assistance will surely make her business prosper.

She dreams of a successful life and career for her children after finishing their college education. She wants to own a decent house for her whole family some day. 

Helen regularly meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional variety of fish in volume quantity

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 48-year-old married mother of five children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Luzviminda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, Luzviminda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 62 years old, married with fourteen children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Alicia has a general store business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 10,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Alicia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Alicia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Belinda is 33 years old and all of children are in school.

Belinda has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. Belinda requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal and firewood to sell.

Belinda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Belinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's welding workshop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetables and spices business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

Elizabeth has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bazana II Village. Maryamu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. In the past, Maryamu suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to provide healthcare for her children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Maryamu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. 

This season Maryamu has grand plans to harvest 52 bags of maize.Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Maryamu  now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields

loans.name: La

texts.en:
La is 21 years old, single and lives in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Currently, he is studying Rural Development in his first year at a university in the province. He has also worked for an organization, making a daily income of USD4 each day. 

La needs financial help to pay his first-year tuition fee and to buy study materials during the academic year, so he would like to apply for a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI.  This loan will help La to have enough finances to go through his first year successfully. 

In the future, he hopes to have a better job with a reasonable salary to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to pay his first-year university tuition in Rural Development and to buy study materials to ensure a prosperous future.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma wants to extend her warmest appreciation for Kiva's support. Because of the PHP 50,000 loan granted her previously, she was able to improve her sari-sari (convenience store) business. 

Wanting to develop her business further, Vilma is asking for another PHP 50,000 loan to acquire more merchandise for her store like grocery items, beverages, and toiletries.  

Vilma sees herself having a better life in the future. She dreams that her children will finish their studies for a better life ahead for them. 

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy ready-to-wear clothes

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 69-year-old married mother of two children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Maria has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Maria has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Maria would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. Janet is married and has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of fish to sell.

Janet has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Janet would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Noemi works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines,and earns additional income from a general store. Noemi is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more rice to sell to customers.

Noemi has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Justice For Good Group

texts.en:
Isatu is a member of Justice for good. She is married with six children age thirty, twenty five, eighteen, twelve, eight and two years old. Five of them are school going children. (see group picture, Isatu is on the right).

Seven years ago Isatu established her slipper business to support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material and provides food from the profit she gets from the business. She sells six days per week from 10 am to 6 pm.

Isatu plans to use the loan to buy 20 bags of different types of slippers for resale. She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account which will be used to pay her children's school fees. Isatu plans to give her children the best education, build a house and live a happy life.

Isatu and her group members need a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL of which Isatu is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL. Isatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of different types of slippers for resale

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco est un père de famille consciencieux, travailleur et dynamique. Il a deux enfants âgés de 6 et 10 ans. Ces derniers vont à l'école. Il est marié, sa femme dirige un magasin général pour l'aider à soutenir la famille. Quant à Jean Bosco, il tient un petit magasin d'alimentation depuis 2012. Il est spécialiste en cuisson et vente du fameux repas malagasy "vary amin'ny anana sy kitoza": soupe de riz cuit avec des brèdes accompagné de steak grillé (repas pour petit déjeuner ou diner).
Pour pouvoir gagner beaucoup plus de revenu, il désire développer et améliorer son activité: réaménager en brique le magasin qui est encore en bois, augmenter le nombre de plats servis, etc....
Ainsi, il souhaite construire une maison d'habitation pour ne plus louer.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is a conscientious father of a family. He is hard-working and energetic and has two children, aged 6 and 10, of whom both go to school. Jean Bosco is married, and his wife runs a general store to help him out in supporting the family. Jean Bosco himself has had a small shop since 2012. He specializes in cooking and selling a famous Malagasy meal “vary amin'ny anana sy kitoza": rice soup cooked with brèdes and served with grilled steak (a meal for breakfast or dinner). 

To earn more income, he would like to develop his business and improve it: renovate his wooden shop with bricks and increase the number of dishes served, etc…. Thus, his wish is to build a house, so as to stop having to rent.

loans.use: to purchase a few sacks of ice, some meats, vegetables, and different ingredients, fish, charcoal, etc. ....

loans.name: Lenny Ann

texts.en:
Lenny Ann is 40 years old and married with three children, all in school, Lenny Ann works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Lenny Ann has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Lenny Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 40 years old. He is married to Alice and supports four children. He is a small-scale farmer earning an income of 10,000 KES per month.

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers and seeds to improve his farming. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve his family's living standards. His hope is to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and seeds to improve his farming.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 45 years old and married with three children. She is in the poultry business in the Philippines. 

Shirley has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her poultry. She has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva to sustain it.

Shirley is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her poultry.

loans.name: Falconerie

texts.en:
Falconerie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Falconerie is 52 years old and has one child in school.

Falconerie buys and sells recycled materials in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to sell.

She has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 47 years old, is married and has four children. He is a farmer, managing and cultivating a two-hectare rice field for income. Ricardo is a responsible man and ensures good profits to sustain his family. His wife is a retail store owner. In his rice field, he plants and harvest rice to sell. 

He is now asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to invest in farming. He will buy fertilizers and insecticides and pay labor costs. He hopes this loan will be given to him as additional revolving capital for maintaining his crops for an eventual bountiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José es una persona alegre, sonriente, el inicio un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en la zona de Tierra alta un lugar que tiene problemas de orden público, habitan personas humildes, escasea el empleo, pero está lleno de personas con ganas de salir adelante y de buscar un excelente futuro para su familia como es el caso de José.

Inicio con un capital bajo, teniendo pocas estanterías, conforme iba ganando dinero invertía en construcción de madera para exhibir más y más productos, porque se proyectaba como un empresario exitoso.

Su mayor sueño es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, tener un negocio amplio, sueña con que llegue el día de que los lcientes deban cancelar en una registradora sus productos eso lo llena de alegría y de compromiso de trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo para abastecer sus estanterías, con granos y abarrotes principalmente, como arroz, frijol, mantequilla, aceite, panela, café.
texts.en:
Joseph is a cheerful, smiling person. He started a grocery store business in a high altitude location; a place with problems of public order, where humble people live, and jobs are scarce, but it is full of people who want to get ahead and who are looking for a good future for their family, as in Joseph’s case.

Joseph began with a small amount of capital, and a few shelves of products. As he made money he invested in wood construction to display more and more products, because it projected the business as successful.

His biggest dream is to be able to pay for his children’s education, improve their housing conditions, and have an extensive business. He dreams of the day when clients can pay for products on credit through a register, which would fill him with joy and commitment to his work.

Joseph is requesting a loan to stock his shelves, mainly with grain and groceries, such as rice, beans, butter, oil, cane sugar, and coffee.

loans.use: to stock his shelves with grains and groceries, such as rice, beans, butter, oil, cane sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Gina Marcela

texts.es:
Gina es una empresaria de 29 años de edad, confeccionista que está empeñada en sacar su propia línea de ropa, en las fotos se puede apreciar algunos de sus trabajos que realiza con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, tratando de crear prendas de calidad y ofertarlas a excelentes precios.

Inicio su negocio por gusto, quiere ser una diseñadora de moda, impulsar su estilo imponerse en el mundo de la moda.

Ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar telas a su elección que usara en la nueva colección que tiene en mente. 

Este empresa no solo es pasión gracias a ella genera el sustento on el que mantiene su hijo de 6 años de edad.
texts.en: Gina is a 29 year old businesswoman. She is a clothes designer, committed to have her own line of clothes. On the photographs one can see some of the work she has done with a lot of effort, trying to create quality items and sell them at excellent prices. She started her business because of her love of it. She wants to be a fashion designer, to boost her style and be successful in the fashion world. She wants to request a loan to buy fabrics of her choice that she will use in the new collection she has in mind. This company is not only a passion; thanks to it she generates the income with which she supports her six year old son.

loans.use: to buy fabrics of her choice that she will use in the new collection she has in mind.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven, Erlinda works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a cafeteria.  

Erlinda, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva, is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Diego Ferney

texts.es:
Diego es un creativo joven de 19 años de edad que impulsado por su deseo de estudiar y apoyar a su madre inicio con un negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar (tienda típica de barrio), pero con un pequeño cambio, las tiendas tradiciones es atención personalizada, el cliente pide los artículos y el tenedero los trae, él está tratando de cambiar un poco este paradigma construyendo una tienda de autoservicio, algo parecido a un mini mercado pero no tan grande.

Diego busca un apoyo financiero para la compra de surtido en abarrotes, refrescos, mecatos, desea abastecer su negocio cada vez con más productos, el motivo del monto es que Diego busca tener en su local todos los alimentos, implementos de aseo que se llevan en un mercado, para que sus clientes puedan encontrar todo en un mismo lugar.

Tu préstamo ayudara a que este joven no solo genere gatos para ayudar en su hogar, si no también pueda pagar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en: Diego is a creative 19 year old young man, who motivated by his desire to study and support his mother, started a store selling basic food items (a typical neighborhood store), but somewhat different to traditional stores which have personalized attention. In traditional stores the customer orders items and the shopkeeper delivers them. He is trying to change this paradigm by building a self-service store, something similar to a mini mall, but not so big. Diego is looking for financial support to buy a stock of grocery items, soft drinks, snacks. He wants to stock up his store with more products. The reason of the amount requested is that Diego is looking to have more food items in his store, cleaning items that are found at a market, so that his customers can find everything in a same place. Your loan will help this young man, not only to earn income to support his household, but also to be able to pay for his college education.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of grocery store items, soft drinks, snacks to stock up his store.

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Group

texts.en:
Maa Saraswati Group was started in the year 2015 at Biranarayanapur village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. They are five active self-dependent women, with the objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of this group have their own profession and business. Damayanti is one of them who has taken a great role for her development and their group members’ livelihood improvement. She is standing in the middle with raised hand in the photo. She is about 33 years old and living with her small family, her husband and only one child. 

Damayanti has been engaged with tailoring as an occupation in her own home of Biranarayanapur for the last three years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the tailoring business. Through this business she earns a monthly income of 4,500 INR. Her opinion is that from this small income, it is very difficult to support her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of her business.

She plans to purchase a number of tailoring raw materials and another tailoring machine from the local market. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for construction of a house and provide better education to her child.

The other four members of the group are also good at their professions and also actively engaged with different professions like vegetable vending, milk business and a goat business. With this loan, they all hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase a number of tailoring raw materials and another tailoring machine

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Con una sonrisa en el resto e ilusionado con generar muchas ventas diarias abre todos los días Luis su negocio de venta de ropa para hombre, dama y accesorios.

Luis tiene 42 años de edad, es soltero pero tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad que vive con la madre y le manda dinero cada semana para su sostenimiento.

Luis vive en un apartamento arrendado, el negocio lo alquila, su sueño y meta es poder comprar primeramente el local y en un futuro comprar una vivienda propia, son los objetivos y metas que tiene con el negocio.

Luis le gustaría tener un apoyo financiero para la compra de surtido de ropa y accesorios para mujer que son los productos que más se vende y mayores ganancias generan  en su tienda.
texts.en:
Luis opens his business every day with a smile on his face, excited about generating a lot of sales. He sells clothing and accessories for men and women.
He is 42 years old and single, but has a nine-year-old son who lives with the mother to whom he sends money every week for his care.

Luis lives in a rented apartment and he also rents his shop for his business. His goal and his dream is first to be able to buy the store, and in the future to buy his own home. Luis would like to have financial support to buy an assortment of women's clothing and accessories because those are the best-selling and highest profit items he sells in the store.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of women's clothing and accessories which are the items that sell the best.

loans.name: Maa Tulasi Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015, five self-dependent women of Biranarayanapur village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India formed a group named Maa Tulsi. Their main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their livelihood by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Kandagiri is the most active and energetic lady of this village and has taken the leadership to form a joint liability group. 

This dazzling lady is about 35 years old and is standing in the middle of the row with raised hand in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of herself, her husband, and two children.

For the last six years, Kandagiri has been engaged in a dairy business with the help and support of her husband. She earns a monthly income of Rs.6,500 from her occupation. But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So she decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business through a loan. With this loan she can purchase another two or three  cows from nearest market. In this way, she hopes that she will generate a handsome extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and re-construct her existing house. 

The other four members of the group are also engaged in different small businesses like milk sales, a ferry business, and a goat business, etc.

loans.use: purchase another two or three cows for her dairy business

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 67 años y ha estado casada por 50 años. Desde una edad muy corta, desarrolló sus habilidades y su gusto por escribir libros para niños de todas las edades, desde preescolar hasta primaria. Sara combinó sus habilidades con el deseo por mejorar la educación y empezar un negocio vendiendo sus propios libros. Actualmente casi todos sus libros se enfocan en niños menores de primaria. Sara está solicitando un préstamo por MXN 11,000 para crear publicidad y ser más reconocida en todo el país. Sara siempre ha tenido un deseo muy grande: compartir todo lo que ha hecho con su familia para dejarles un legado a sus propios nietos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable y con muchas ganas de emprender, por lo que quiere iniciar otro negocio en el futuro para tener un ingreso extra. Sara está muy agradecida con Kiva y los prestamistas por apoyarla en su sueño de dejar una huella en todos los niños de México. Con este préstamo podrá generar mayores ganancias, que le permitirán estar en tiempo con sus fechas de pago en su cuarto préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en: Sara is 67 years old and has been married for 50 years. From a very young age, she developed her skills and penchant for writing books for children of all ages, from kindergarten to elementary school. Sara combined her skills with the desire to improve education and started a business selling her own books. Currently most of her books focus on children below primary school age. Sara is requesting a loan of MXN 11,000 to create advertising and be recognized throughout the country. Sara has always had a very great desire to share everything she has done with her family to leave a legacy to her own grandchildren. She is a very hardworking, responsible and eager woman who wants to start another business in the future to have extra income. Sara is very grateful to Kiva lenders who support her dream of leaving a mark on all children in Mexico. With this loan she can generate higher profits, allowing her to be on time with her payment dates on her fourth loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to advertise in different regions

loans.name: Jerusalen

texts.es: Una mujer independiente y muy trabajadora, Jerusalen nació en 1989 en Tijuana, Baja California, en la frontera con Estados Unidos de América. Para poder finalizar sus estudios universitarios, con sólo unos cuantos pesos, inició un cibercafé hace cuatro años. Hoy, ella ofrece servicio de computadora, impresión, papelería y diseño de proyectos, explotando sus conocimientos adquiridos en la universidad. Jerusalen está solicitando un préstamo por MXN 12,000 para comprar una nueva impresora para agilizar y mejorar el servicio, así como cubrir los gastos operativos. Ella planea casarse el siguiente año e iniciar una familia y le gustaría tener estabilidad económica para poder ofrecerle las mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos. Jerusalen está muy agradecida con todos aquellos que la apoyan para continuar con el éxito de este proyecto. Con este préstamo ella podrá incrementar sus ganancias un 20% semanal, lo que le permitirá realizar pagos satisfactorios en su segundo préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en: An independent and hardworking woman, Jerusalem was born in 1989 in Tijuana, Baja California, on the border with the United States. To finish her university studies, having only a few dollars, she began a cybercafé four years ago. Today, it offers computer, printing, stationery and design projects, using her knowledge acquired in college. Jerusalem is requesting a loan of MXN 12,000 to buy a new printer to speed up and improve the service and to cover operating expenses. She plans to marry next year and start a family and have economic stability that would offer the the best conditions of life to her children. Jerusalem is very grateful to all those who support her to continue the success of this project. With this loan she can increase profits by 20% per week, allowing her to make payments on her second successful loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy a new printer and cover operating expenses

loans.name: Maa Bhawani Group

texts.en:
Maa Bhabani Group was started in the year 2015 at Muniguda village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. They are five active self-dependent women, with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of this group have their own profession and business. 

Santilata is one who taken on a great role for her development and their group members’ livelihood improvement. She is standing in the middle with raised hand in the photo. She is about 27 years old and living with her small family, her husband and only one daughter. 

Santilata has been engaged in a tailoring occupation in her own home at Muniguda for the last eight years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the tailoring. Through this business she earns a monthly income of 6,500 INR. Her opinion is that from this small income it is very difficult to support her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of her business.

She plans to purchase a number of tailoring raw materials and another tailoring machine from the local market. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for re-construction of her house and to provide better education to her daughter.

The other four members of the group are also good at their professions and also actively engaged in different professions like a rice business, a mixture shop, a tailor shop and a seasonal business. With this loan, they hope to boost their livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a number of tailoring raw materials and another tailoring machine

loans.name: Beatriz Eugenia

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 49 años y está divorciada. Además de su empleo administrativo en una empresa, hace unos meses se convirtió en una empresaria, siguiendo sus ganas de emprender algo y tener su propio dinero. En su negocio vende productos nutricionales y suplementos alimenticios para cubrir los gastos educativos de su hija. Es una mujer muy responsable que siempre ha buscado la manera de sacar a su hija adelante para que nunca le falte nada. Ella quiere mejorar sus habilidades y oportunidades en el trabajo para poder dejar una enseñanza a todos aquellos que sientan la necesidad de aprender nuevas cosas. Su sueño es motivar a todas las mujeres mexicanas a que se atrevan a emprender su propio negocio al igual que ella. Con un préstamo de MXN 6,500 ella será capaz de comprar productos nutricionales para tener un inventario más grande, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ganancias en menor tiempo y cumplir su meta de abrir diferentes sucursales en toda la región. Este es el primer préstamo de Beatriz con Konfío y está muy agradecida con Kiva y los prestamistas por confiar en ella en su camino hacia el éxito.
texts.en: Beatriz is 49 years old and is divorced. In addition to her administrative job at a company, a few months ago she became a businesswoman, following her desire to start something and have her own money. In her business, she  sells nutritional products and dietary supplements to cover the educational expenses of her daughter. She is a very responsible woman who has always looked for ways to take her daughter along for her to never miss anything. She wants to improve her skills and job opportunities to teach all those who feel the need to learn new things. Her dream is to motivate all Mexican women who dare to start their own business just like her. With a loan of MXN 6,500 she will be able to buy nutritional products to have a larger inventory, allowing her to have higher profits in less time and meet her goal of opening different branches throughout the region. This is Beatriz's first loan with Konfío, and she is very grateful to Kiva lenders who trust her on your way to success.

loans.use: to buy nutritional products and dietary supplements

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda y además vende antojitos, tiene 5 años de experiencia y gracias a la ventas que realiza es como ha podido salir adelante con su familia,  su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, jugos, leche, pan dulce, sopas, huevos, azúcar, etc. todo por mayor para surtir mas la tienda y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face has been pixelated because she's 24 and lives in a high-risk area, has a small store and also sells snacks.  She has five years of experience and has been able to get ahead with her family thanks to her sales.  Her business is located in her house.  She lives in her own home with her life partner and her child.

She's requesting a loan to make a wholesale purchase of more stock for her store: basic grains, juice, milk, pan dulce [sweet bread], soup, eggs, sugar, etc.  That way she'll be able to earn more income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to make a wholesale purchase of basic grains, juice, milk, sweet bread, soup, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Pachacutec Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PACHACUTEC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yulisa ella es soltera y tiene 29 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia lleva los productos de belleza a diferentes lugares y amigos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de internet.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank Pachacutec. This bank is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Yulisa. She is single and 29 years old. She works selling beauty products. She sells lipsticks, creams and perfumes. She is a hard working woman who through this work is bringing up her children. She sells her beauty products in various places and to friends. She is asking for a loan to buy creams, lipsticks, and perfumes.

The members who appear in the attached photo had their pictures taken after the group meeting because they requested permission to be absent for work reasons. 

The other members engage in businesses such as selling food, selling clothes, operating a grocery store, and managing an Internet business.

Yulisa appreciates those who have helped to fulfill her dream in this manner so she promises to complete her payment according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipsticks, and perfumes.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase materials for maintaining the computer units in her shop. It was indeed a milestone for her, most especially as she was able to provide a better income for her family.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for the same reason. She would use this to maintain her computer shop and at the same time add more units which she will need to increase her profit. She hopes that your hearts will be touched and your support will be with her in her aim to be better.

Lorie hopes that her business will just continue to expand for her family to have better living conditions. She just wants to earn enough money so that she can buy her own house someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her Piso Net units.

loans.name: Nefer Milena

texts.es:
En el Hogar infantil de Nefer se respira paz, tranquilidad, convivencia y amor, ella una madre cabeza de familia de 40 años que se dedica a cuidar niños y que ha pasado por grandes adversidades en su vida como lo fue la separación con su esposo decidió darle todo su amor no a un hombre si no a esas criaturas pequeñas que le alegran el corazón.

Es madre de dos hijos uno de 22 y otro  de 7 que vive y dependen económica de ella, trabaja pro su hogar infantil pro sus muchachos, por tener una vivienda propia.

Nefer actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para hacer de su hogar infantil un espacio más lindo y cómodo para sus muchachos, parte pro necesidad debido a las presiones que unas entidades regulatorias ponen sobre ella, por ello el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para poner cerámica en el baño y el piso de la cocina.
texts.en:
In Nefer’s children’s home there is peace, tranquility, harmony, and love. She is a female head of household who has been caring for children for 40 years, and she has gone through great adversities in her life, such as the separation from her husband. She decided to give all her love, not to a man, but to the little children who bring joy to the heart.

She is the mother of two children, ages 22 and 7, who live with her and depend upon her financially. She works for her children’s home and for her kids to have a home of their own.

Currently, Nefer is requesting a loan to make her children’s home prettier and more comfortable for her kids. This is partly out of necessity, due to pressures that some regulatory agencies are putting on her. She will invest the money in the purchase of materials to put tile in the bathroom and on the floor of the kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase materials to put tile in the bathroom and on the floor of the kitchen.

loans.name: Jocelyn Alejandra

texts.es: Sonriente y con mucha iniciativa, Jocelyn nació en 1978 en Coyoacán, Ciudad de México. Ella planea iniciar una familia en un futuro no muy lejano y le gustaría darle la mejor calidad de vida posible a sus hijos. Jocelyn fundó una editorial en 2010 como resultado de su pasión por los libros y el deseo de mejorar la cultura en la sociedad. Su negocio está ubicado en un departamento por el momento pero le gustaría llevarlo hacia un establecimiento más formal. Gracias al crecimiento que ha tenido su compañía, ahora también ofrecen libros electrónicos y todos los servicios editoriales, desde los trámites legales hasta el diseño, edición y publicación. Este es el segundo préstamo de Jocelyn con Konfío; el anterior le ayudó a cubrir los gastos operativos y pagar por el mantenimiento de los equipos. Ahora está solicitando un préstamo por MXN 12,000 para crear publicidad y anunciarse en más puntos de México, lo que atraería a más clientes. Jocelyn está muy agradecida con Kiva, Konfío y los prestamistas por confiar en ella y ayudarle a que sus sueños se vuelvan realidad en el proyecto de su vida. Jocelyn confía en que sabrá manejar bien sus finanzas para realizar pagos satisfactorios.
texts.en:
Smiling and with great initiative, Jocelyn was born in 1978 in Coyoacan, Mexico City. She plans to start a family in the near future and would like to give the best possible quality of life for her children. Jocelyn founded a publishing house in 2010 as a result of her passion for books and the desire to improve the culture in society. Her business is located in an apartment at the moment but she would like to carry it out in a more formal setting. Thanks to the growth that her company has had, she now also offers electronic books and all publishing services, from legal procedures to design, editing and publishing. 

This is the second loan that Jocelyn has had with Konfío; her previous loan helped cover operating expenses and to pay for equipment maintenance. She is now requesting a loan of 12,000 MXN to create advertising and advertise her business in most parts of Mexico, which will attract more customers for her business. Jocelyn is very grateful to Kiva, Konfío and the lenders that trust in her and help make her dreams come true in the project of her life. Jocelyn trusts in herself that she will know how to manage her finances well and make satisfactory payments.

loans.use: to advertise her publishing business in different parts of Mexico

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS DE AMAYBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Hilda se dedica al negocio de restaurant, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank Las Palmeras de Amaybamba. The bank is located in the Huayopata district, which belongs to the La Convencion province and the Cusco administrative division. 

Hilda works in the restaurant business. She is an enterprising woman who, by means of this business, hopes that her children can finish school. Her dream is to own a large restaurant. The member is requesting a loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat. 

The member is grateful for this loan and promises to make all her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

loans.name: Mbuto Nyija Group

texts.fr: Riziculteur depuis 2003, Matthias l'a appris de ses parents et ses frères qui l'ont aidé à entretenir son premier champ. Après 12 ans d'expérience, il se plait de la période de récolte car ils gagnent plus à manger quoique que parfois il y a baisse de prix sur le marché au niveau local et les insectes/ maladies qui détruisent les champs. Il souhaite un peu plus tard cultiver au moins 3 hectares grâce au crédit qu'il aura à bénéficier auprès de PAIDEK pour ainsi assurer la scolarité de ses enfants jusqu'au niveau universitaire. Président du groupe MBUTO NYIJA, Matthias tient un carnet sur la photo.
texts.en: A rice grower since 2003, Matthias learned this trade from his parents and brothers, who helped him to maintain his first field. After 12 years of experience, he is happy at harvest time, since they earn more to eat, although there is sometimes a drop in local market prices, and there are insects/ diseases, which destroy the fields. Matthias would like to farm at least 3 hectares a bit later, thanks to the loan he will obtain from the microfinance institution PAIDEK, thus ensuring his children’s education through the university level. Matthias, the president of the group called MBUTO NYIJA, is the one holding a notebook in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, transplanting, harvesting, plant care products, and fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Lilibeth

texts.en:
Ma. Lilibeth is a rice farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is 38 years old, married with six children. Her eldest is sixteen and her youngest is two. Farming entails hard work and this is not easy for the mother of six. She also cooks snacks like rice cakes, budbud (slightly sweet sticky rice wrapped in banana leaves  and coconut milk) and popsicles. 

Ma. Lilibeth needs help through a loan. She needs 17000 PHP to buy fertilizer, seedlings, pay for labor and pesticides. Is is her dream to see her children become well-educated and professionals. She also wished to live a more prosperous life through hard work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, pay for labor and pesticides

loans.name: Fotemogoban 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  8 membres du groupe  Fotemogoban  2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kokouna, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, avec Aminata débout au milieu sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et des femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group "Fotemogoban 2” are married women, who average 39 years of age and six children each, all living in traditional families in Kokouna, a village in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 6th loan with the institution, and the past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. Aminata, who is standing in the middle in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing for maintaining: 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 85,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help out her big family in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and manual labor

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! This is Rosalie, and recently she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan which she used for her junk shop business. She was so glad to be given the chance to receive an amount like this for the improvement of her business. 

Continuing to grow her inventory, Rosalie is asking for your help again. She believes that people like you can help change her fate. She is requesting another 30,000 PHP which she will be incorporating into her current revolving fund she uses to buy recyclable materials from collectors. 

With optimism and hope, she envisions herself someday seeing her children in their own professions after schooling. She also hopes her business will continue to get bigger and better. 

Rosalie meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials from collectors for her junk shop.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
En una pequeña y apacible comunidad del Estado de México se formó el grupo San Isidro, todas las integrantes reflejan las cualidades de la región ya que son muy amigables y trabajadoras. Los habitantes de dicha comunidad, que aún conservan sus raíces mazahuas, se dedican mayormente a la cría de animales de corral y a la agricultura dando prioridad al maíz que es la base de su alimentación. 
   Doña Azucena es una persona muy agradable, todo el que la conoce le llama Susy de cariño. Está casada con David desde hace quince años y juntos han formado una gran familia con cuatro hijos que actualmente estudian. 
   Durante cuatro años tuvo una tienda de abarrotes desgraciadamente tuvo que cerrarla por algunos inconvenientes pero ahora comenzó un nuevo negocio. "Siempre me ha gustado ayudar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de mis hijos; cuando tuve que cerrar la tienda fue algo triste, afortunadamente mi mamá vende en la terminal de autobuses del municipio y me propuso vender bonetería junto a ella".
   De tal manera que ahora lleva seis años dedicados a la compra y venta de artículos de bonetería como hilos, estambres, listones, etc. Todos los días, después de enviar a sus hijos a la escuela, acude a su puesto para comenzar desde temprano la venta que hasta ahora no ha parado. 
  La meta de Doña Susy es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia es por eso que destina ingresos en la educación de sus hijos. El préstamo lo ocupará para comprar mayor y más variada mercancía. 
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Araceli quien invertirá en tarjetas telefónicas de tiempo aire, Leticia y María Guadalupe en ropa, Silvia en paletas y helados, Graciela en dulces y refrescos y Anayeli en perfumes.
 *La fotografía fue tomada en el centro del municipio, Doña Susy es quien carga al bebé.
texts.en:
The San Isidro group was formed in a small, pleasant community in Mexico, and all of its members are friendly and hardworking, a reflection of the characteristics of the region. This community, which preserves its Mazahua roots, is primarily dedicated to raising farm animals and to agriculture, especially corn, which is the foundation of their diet.

Azucena is a likeable person, and those who know her lovingly call her Susy. She has been married to David for 15 years and together they have a large family of four children, all of whom are currently in school. For four years Azucena owned a grocery store, but unfortunately she had to close it due to some issues. Now she has started a new business. She says, "I have always liked to help out with the household expenses and with my children's education. Having to close my store was very sad, but fortunately my mother sells at the bus station and she suggested that I sell sewing products with her."

Now Azucena has been working for six years buying and selling sewing products, such as thread, yarn, ribbon, etc. Every day, after dropping her children off at school, she goes to her post to start early on her sales. Susy's goal is to give her family a better quality of life, so she has been setting aside funds for her children's education. She will use this loan to buy more varied merchandise.

As for the other members of the group, Araceli will invest in prepaid phone cards, Leticia and María Guadalupe in clothing, Silvia in popsicles and ice cream, Graciela in candy and soda, and Anayeli in perfumes. 

* The photograph was taken in the town center. Susy is the one holding the baby.

loans.use: Comprara hilos, estambres, aujas, cortauñas etc.

location.town: EL TUNAL, SAN FELIPE DEL PROGRESO

loans.name: Manuel Francisco

texts.es:
Manuel, es agricultor, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y una hija, ambas desempeñan labores domésticas y atienden un negocio de alquiler de sillas, mesas y manteles, ya tiene 20 años de residir en su comunidad, él cultiva maíz y frijol en terrenos propios, es un oficio que ha realizado de toda su vida y se decidió a tener su propio negocio hace 25 años.
Necesita complementar los trabajos de preparación del terreno para cultivar en esta temporada, el capital lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar obreros para desarrollar las diferentes actividades de siembra, espera que los resultados sean una cosecha abundante y mejores ingresos para poder respaldar el pago de su deuda.
Manuel sueña tener estabilidad económica, almacenar mayor cantidad de granos básicos para sacarlos al mercado cuando los precios sean favorables y lo más importante cubrir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Manuel is a farmer.  He lives in his own house with his life partner and a daughter.  Both of them do the household chores and tend to a business of renting tables, chairs, and tablecloths.  He has been living in his community for 20 years.  He grows corn and beans on his own land, and it is work that he has done all of his life.  He decided to have his own business 25 years ago.

He needs to add land preparation to his work in order to cultivate the land this season.  He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies and to pay the workers for their different planting jobs.  He hopes that the results will be an abundant harvest and better income so that he will be able to pay back his debt.

Manuel dreams of having financial stability, storing a greater quantity of basic grains to take to the market when the prices are favorable, and, most importantly, covering his family’s necessities.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay the workers for their different planting jobs.

loans.name: Gedeliza

texts.en:
Gedeliza is 38 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Gedeliza works very hard to provide for them.

Gedeliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Gedeliza has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Gedeliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 55 años, es un productor de café de una comunidad rural de Nueva Segovia, donde vive con su compañera y sus dos hijos. Parte de su tiempo la dedica a la producción de café que ha establecido en 4.4 hectáreas, la cual maneja bajo criterios de certificación de comercio justo. En los últimos tres años la producción de café de este pequeño productor ha incrementado hasta en un 50%.

Para este año, él está solicitando un crédito para comprar los insumos que requiere su cafetal y garantizar su implementación de manera oportuna, y poder lograr su meta de incrementar los rendimientos productivos de su cafetal para contar con mayores ingresos y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia.

El sueño de este pequeño productor es dejar a sus hijos una finca productiva y sostenible, y está seguro que el café es un rubro de alto potencial económico con el cual puede tener mejores ingresos para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Luis is 55 years old. He is coffee producer in a rural community in Nueva Segovia where he lives with his wife and two children. Part of his time he works producing coffee on 4.4 hectares which he manages according to the Fair Trade Coffee certification.

In the last three years the production of this small producer has increased as much as 50 %. For this year he is requesting a loan to buy the inputs he needs for his coffee crops and guarantee it's timely application and be able to meet his goal of of increased production on his plantation to have more income and improve the family's economic situation.

The dream of this small producer is to leave a productive and sustainable farm to his children and he is sure that coffee is a high growth potential field where he can make better income to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to apply on his coffee crops to have a good harvest and greater income.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is a strong, hardworking woman who served her community for thirty-five years as a school bus driver. She is proud of the years she spent transporting children safely between their homes and school. Her main goal during all of these years of hard work was to buy her own home and maintain it so that she would always have a place to call her own.

After working for nearly a decade, Olive was able to save enough to finance a home of her own. Olive has put great care into maintaining her home, as it is her pride and joy, but after the housing market collapsed, she was left with no equity and high payments. Luckily, she was able to negotiate the terms of her payments due to policy and laws instituted to protect people in her situation, and she now has a lower monthly payment, but the damage to her credit is done.

While Olive was trying to negotiate the terms of her mortgage, she fell behind financially and this reflected on her credit history. Olive has also been the victim of fraud due to someone using her information to make purchases. Olive has since made efforts to pay any balances she owes, and she has also reported any transactions that are not her own and has assisted with resolving those issues.

Olive feels that she is finally on track, but now she needs a bit of help. Olive’s air conditioner has completely stopped working, and she has experienced difficulty financing a new one due to late payments showing up on her credit history. Her home is currently so hot that she has difficulty sleeping at night. Olive would benefit greatly from a new high-efficiency air conditioner that will help improve her quality of life and make her home more livable. This loan will also help Olive rebuild her damaged credit and lower her monthly energy bills when compared to her old inefficient unit.

Olive will use her loan to pay for a new high-efficiency air conditioner that will greatly improve the living conditions within her home and help improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for a new high-efficiency air conditioner that will greatly improve the living conditions within her home and help improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Bridjkisoor

texts.en:
Bridjkisoor, 46 years old, lives with his wife and three school-aged children. A well-known rice farmer who has done business with Seva MFI since 2009,  he expanded his rice fields last season and bought a tractor to earn extra income to save for his children's studies. 

To visit and for the transportation of fertilizers and pesticides to his rice areas, Bridjkisoor wants to buy a van (panel truck) and so has requested a loan of 10,000 SRD for that purpose.

loans.use: to buy a van (panel truck)

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants"ngassamack3" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Épouses des enseignants «  Ngassamack 3 » qui compte cinq membres est un sous groupe d’une grande association dont les membres sont actifs dans le commerce. La présidente, madame Nafissatou, âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfant dont l’ainé a 7 ans, évolue dans la vente  de chaussures et de sacs depuis 3 ans maintenant. Elle travaille aussi comme ménagère depuis 5 ans  dans une banque de la place où elle reçoit en contre partie un salaire qui lui permet de participer à la gestion du foyer. Grâce  au crédit, elle peut acheter  des chaussures et des sacs et les proposer aux employés de la dite banque, dans ce cas, le recouvrement est beaucoup plus facile pour elle. 
Ce qu’elle a comme projet, c’est de construire sa propre maison et d’améliorer son activité en renforçant davantage son capital.
texts.en:
The group called “Épouses des enseignants Ngassamack 3” is composed of five members, and it is a subgroup of a big association whose members are active in commerce. The president, Ms. Nafissatou, is 30 years old and a married mother of three children, of whom the oldest, a son, is 7 years old. She has been selling shoes and bags for three years now. She has also been working as a housekeeper for five years at a local bank, where she receives in return a salary enabling her to help manage her home. 

Thanks to this loan, she can purchase some shoes and bags and offer them to the employees of the above-mentioned bank. In this case, the payments are much more easily collected for her. Her future plans include building a house of her own and improving her business by bolstering her capital further.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and bags to resell

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es: Ana tiene 34 años de edad y vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos una niña de 18 años y un varón de 17 años de edad. Ana presta sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar desde hace varios años, lo que le permite sostener a su familia y brindar todo lo que está en sus manos. Ana desea mejorar la entrada de su vivienda, ya que esta es de tierra y en época de invierno el ingreso a su vivienda es difícil, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir unas gradas para mejorar la entrada de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Ana, age 34, lives with her life partner and their two children, an 18 year old daughter and a 17 year old son.  Ana has been providing domestic services in homes for several years.  This allows her to support her family and to provide everything within her reach.

Ana wishes to improve the entryway to her house.  It is made of dirt, and during the winter season entering her house is difficult.  That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron in order to build some steps to improve the entry way to her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron.

loans.name: Gulbaira

texts.ru: Гулбайра, 37 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Гулбайры- высшее образование, уже 16 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у Гулбайры имеется 2 коровы и 8 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулбайра обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки 2 дойных коров для продажи экологически-чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Гулбайра хочет вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на постройку дома.
texts.en: Gulbaira is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Gulbaira has a higher education. She has been rearing animals for the last 16 years. Thanks to her hard work, today Gulbaira has two cows and eight sheep. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Gulbaira has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy two dairy cows to sell organic milk. Gulbaira wants to invest the proceeds of the loan in increasing her number of livestock, and plans to save up to build a house.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to increase her organic milk sales.

loans.name: Otto Vladimir

texts.es:
Otto, ofrece el servicio de un taller de estructuras metálicas y construcciones de viviendas, vive con su esposa y dos hijos con edades de  4 y 8 años, toda la familia es dependiente; tiene su propio negocio desde hace 7 años, según sea su demanda realiza sus trabajos con la ayuda de 3 ó 4 obreros, su ventaja es la poca competencia que existe en la zona,  el oficio lo aprendió cuando por un tiempo trabajaba como ayudante y posteriormente asistió a clases para mejorar sus conocimientos.
Está solicitando un crédito para complementar el valor de la compra de una motocicleta que necesita para trasladarse hacia su trabajo, de esta forma podrá agilizar la entrega de sus trabajos y podrá atender a nuevos clientes, los riesgos del negocio son caídas o accidentes con sus herramientas.
Su visión es mejorar sus servicios, darle a sus hijos mejor educación para que tenga oportunidades de superación en la sociedad y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Otto has a metal structure and housing construction workshop.  He lives with his wife and their two children, ages four and eight.  The whole family is independent.  He has had his own business for seven years.  He does his jobs with the help of three or four workers depending upon the demand.  The advantage is that there is little competition in the area.  He learned this work when he worked as a helper for some time.  Later, he attended classes to improve his knowledge.

He is requesting a loan to supplement what he has to buy a motorcycle that he needs to get to his work.  This way he will be able to streamline the completion of his jobs.  He will be able to tend to new customers.  The risks of his business are falls or accidents with his tools.

His vision is to improve his services, to give his children a better education so the they have better opportunities for success in the world, and to finish building his house.

loans.use: to supplement what he has to buy a motorcycle that he needs to get to his work.

loans.name: Tolgonai

texts.ru: Толгонай, 29 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Толгонай средне-специальное образование, она занимается сельским хозяйством. Толгонай успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, в котором у нее имеется: 3 коровы, 10 овец. На 1,28 Га она выращивает арбузы и хлопок. Бизнес Толгонай на сегодняшний день приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере 14,000 сом (KGS). Толгонай решила обратиться в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку рассады и удобрений для выращивания экологически-чистых овощей. Толгонай хочет увеличить свой бизнес и накопить на приобретение авто.
texts.en: Tolgonai is 29 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Tolgonai has a secondary vocational education. She works in agriculture. Tolgonai is the successful owner of her own small farm on which she has three cows and ten sheep. She grows watermelon and cotton on 1.28 hectares of land. Tolgonai's business currently brings in a monthly profit of 14,000 som (KGS). Tolgonai has decided to apply to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy seedlings and fertilizer to grow organic vegetables. Tolgonai wants to grow her business and save up to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer to treat her land and grow organic produce.

loans.name: Junette

texts.fr: Junette, 32 ans, vit en union libre, mère d’un enfant, est revendeuse de produits alimentaires(riz, sucre, beurre, haricot, etc). Elle exerce son activité à domicile. Elle a beaucoup de clients dans le voisinage. Elle espère apporter une amélioration dans sa situation financière à travers les revenus de cette activité. Son rêve est de développer l’activité afin d’y gagner plus de bénéficies. Elle cherche un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Junette is 32 years old, lives with her partner, and is the mother of one child. She sells food products (rice, sugar, butter, beans, etc.). She conducts her business out of her home. She has many customers from the neighborhood. 

She hopes to improve her financial situation from the earnings of this business. Her dream is to develop her business in order to make more profits.

She is seeking a micro-loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy bags of yellow sugar

loans.name: Jeckson Luis

texts.es:
Jeckson Luis es un joven estudiante de Piscologia Educativa, él solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Jeckson Luis, nací en Bonao, provincia Monseñor Nouel y resido con mis padres y hermanos en esta misma ciudad, gracias a Dios he tenido la oportunidad de vivir y desarrollarme en la ciudad en que nací.
A finales del 2008, cuando cursaba el primer semestre del cuarto de bachillerato, la empresa en la que mi padre laboraba se vio en la necesidad de despedir personal por la situación en la que se encontraba, tanto por la baja del níquel como de los costos de producción y mi padre fue uno de los despedidos. Gracias a Dios me dieron la oportunidad de terminar el cuarto del bachillerato en el colegio que estaba, pues la mayor cantidad de dinero de las cuotas mensuales la cubría la empresa.
En la Universidad UAPA decidí estudiar Psicología Clínica, luego cambié a Psicología Educativa, pues me movía un fuerte deseo de servicio social que me daba mi relación con Dios que adquirí en el bachillerato y que desarrollé en varios años de servicio en la Pastoral Juvenil de mi parroquia. 
De no lograr la ayuda de Kiva no podré continuar estudiando, ya que no contamos con los recursos para hacerlo    
Mi interés  de brindar ayuda es primordialmente con la visión de crear un espacio positivo donde los niños tengan la oportunidad de desarrollarse en algunas áreas que sean alternativas, como lo es la música, el arte, el teatro, manualidades, cocina, talleres de motivación, autoestima, entre otros.
