loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as: shoes, underwear, cosmetics, personal products, and other items, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and jembes (hoes for digging) for cultivating and preparing for planting so as to meet her family's needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a single man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 15 years. He describes himself as being ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells cosmetics. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a developing area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics. His business goal is to open other business branches within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will meet his family's financial needs. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and jembes for cultivating and preparing for planting to meet the family's needs.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She describes herself as being honest. She operates a retail business in which she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a competitive place. She describes her biggest business challenge as being low prices. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions for reselling to retailers

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Sophal, 41, is a married mother of a child who is in school and living in Mondulkiri province. Growing cassava and working on other farms for a fee are the sources of her family’s income for one year. She can earn about 73,000 KHR per day. Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group of three to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to pay for a plowing fee. She hopes to earn more income and have the ability to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to pay for a plowing fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming tools, maize seeds and fertilizers for planting so as to get a better harvest and meet her family's needs.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 30 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children.

Her husband works in the construction field and, in parallel, in farming to satisfy the requirements of life. Until now he has earned a barely sufficient income. For that reason, today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s educational fees.

She said that the loan will surely help her to register her children for the coming school year whicht makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en: Rosebella is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential for business and her primary customers are honest. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy materials to increase business premise space. Her business goal is to be a supplier of fruits within five years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy materials to increase business premise space

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en: Jemimah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and bags. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with potential for business and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open more branches within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have increased sales. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rise and Shine lenders! You have become a blessing once more in the life of Rosana.

Rosana previously took a loan worth PHP 10,000. It was a big help for her in her business journey. Through the granted loan, she was able to buy enough resources and raw materials needed in her tailoring business, like needles, cloth, threads and other important stuff. With that, she found a way to increase her sales.

To continue to expand her inventory, she humbly requests you to grant her a loan worth PHP 10,000 that she would use for the same purpose again. She would like to obtain additional materials needed for making clothes. She hopes you can give her another chance this time, to prove that her dream to someday have a better living and her own house, is worth working hard for.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, where she can share stories of her life and business and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Medellín, se dedica al comercio hace 4 años, es casada y madre de 3 hijos mayores, hoy día ya es muy conocida en el sector donde ubica su negocio.

Se dedica a la venta de insumos para la confección como hilo, encajes, calcomanías, agujas, guías, entre otros, y con ello puede tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. 

Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante y tener una vida llena de éxitos y triunfos.

Pide este préstamo para la  mejora compra una maquina devanadora de hilo, de manera a que pueda incrementar su producción,r sus ingresos por medio de su trabajo y puede ir aumentando su negocio de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city  of Medellín. She has been a merchant for 4 years. She is married and the mother of 3 grown children. Today she is very well known in the area where her business is located.

She sells sewing materials such as thread, lace, transfers, and more. By doing this, she has the means to help her family. She is a very hardworking woman and a fighter who wants to get ahead and have a life full of success and triumphs. 

She is asking for this loan to buy a thread winder so that she can increase production and her income through her work, so she can increase her business in the best way.

loans.use: to buy a thread winder so she can increase her production and her income from her work.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: Tamara is a 51-year-old married woman from Khelvachauri district. She lives with her husband and and 2 children. The only source of income for the family is her husband's small monthly salary, working at a local water supply company as an operator. Tamara is unemployed and she is very motivated to start a new business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 4500 USD. With the received credit she will open a shop. Tamara will purchase building materials to build a shop in Khelvachauri and also will purchase a stock of products to sell in her newly opened shop. Tamara is a very hardworking woman and very motivated to be employed and generate her own income.

loans.use: to open a shop

loans.name: Samalani Group

texts.en:
Margret is 54 years old and a mother of four children. She owns a grocery store in which she sells different kinds of commodities such as biscuits, crisps and cooking oil. She mainly started this business in order to alleviate her household's levels of poverty and pay school fees for her children.

Margret would like to obtain another loan in order to further expand her business by purchasing items that are currently not in stock. She hopes to open a wholesale business and dreams of buying a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, crisps and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Erwin Bayron

texts.es: Erwin es un joven de 33 años de edad, Erwin  se dedica  a la comercialización de zapatos. Erwin también trabajar  en una empresa florícola de operador dando mantenimiento, Erwin vive solo ya que comenta que tuvo que alejarse de su familia por motivo de trabajo ya que en el lugar donde el vivía no existía muchas fuentes de empleo. Erwin solicita el dinero de crédito para comprar mercadería en zapatos. Erwin tiene la aspiración de seguir trabajando duro y de igual manera mejorar su negocio  y estar preparado económicamente  ya que comenta que esta a punto de formar su hogar.
texts.en:
Erwin is a young 33 years old. He earns a living selling shoes. Erwin also works in a flower growing company providing maintenance. Erwin lives alone since he had to move away from his family for work reasons since many sources of employment did not exists in the place where he lived.

Erwin is requesting a loan to buy an inventory of shoes. He has the goal to continue working hard, and also to improve his business and be prepared financially since he mentioned that he is ready to establish a home.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rickshaw for her son

loans.name: Umed

texts.en:
Umed is 59 years old. He is married and lives with his family in the district of Vakhsh. His family consists of 7 people: his father, mother, two brothers, wife and two children. Umed is a very kind, honest and ambitious person. He has higher education and is working in one of the banks in his district.  

Umed needs a treatment for a dermatological disease. Unfortunately, he does not have enough money and for this reason he applied for a loan. Umed hopes that with the support of Kiva lenders he will successfully finish his treatment and will work and provide for his family. He will be very grateful to you for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for a treatment for a dermatological disease

loans.name: Karen Dayana

texts.es:
Karen es una joven de 26 años de edad, soltera, cabeza de familia, tiene un pequeño bebe de 1 año de edad que es su felicidad, significa todo para ella.

Karen quiere crece, ser una empresaria exitosa, salir de la pobreza, una vez se enteró que estaba esperando l bebe de inmediato se puso a la tarea de encontrar una manera de generar ingresos para comprar lo del niño, la ropa, los pañales, le leche, el carro, la cuna, juguetes, baberos, todo le preocupaba y no quiso empelarse porque debía dejar el trabajo por cuidar a su hijo, por ello ingenio una venta de alimentos en su casa y hoy solicita una ayuda para potenciar y comprar mercancía, quiere tener existencias para trabajar por un tiempo, obteniendo ganancias con las que comprara los productos para su bebe y el mantenimiento del hogar e ir pagando el crédito puntualmente.

Con el dinero que solicita Karen invertirá en surtido de helados, carne, chuzos (producto que sostiene en la foto) y bebidas.
texts.en:
Karen is a young woman, age 26. She is single and head of the household. She has a little one-year-old baby who is her happiness, and means everything to her.

Karen wants to grow, to be a successful businesswoman, and lift herself out of poverty. As soon as she found out that she was expecting a baby, she immediately set herself the task of finding a way to generate income to purchase baby items—clothes, diapers, milk, a stroller, a crib, and toys. She thought of everything.  And, she didn’t want to be employed; she wanted to quit work to care for her child. So, she thought of selling food in her house. 

Today she is requesting a loan to improve and to purchase merchandise. She wants to have enough supplies to work for a while and earn income to purchase products for her baby and for maintaining the household, and to keep making loan payments punctually.

With the money that she is requesting, Karen will invest in a supply of ice cream, meat, chuzos (the product that she is holding in the photo), and beverages.

loans.use: to invest in a supply of ice cream, meat, chuzos (the product she is holding in the photo), and beverages.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married  woman with four school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman who has four children, all of whom attend school.She own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She has operated a fuel selling business for the past five years. She mentioned  transportation as a major challenge in her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more fuel for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access business and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fuel for resale

loans.name: Atwi

texts.en:
Atwi is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for whitewash services by her husband.

loans.name: Sophai's Group

texts.en: Sophai is a rural villager living in Mondulkiri province. She is 28 years old and a mother of two children. One of them is in school while the other one is too young to attend school. Nowadays, she grows cassava and works on other farms for a fee to support her family. She has been involved in this business for six years and it earns her about 36,200 KHR per day. Due to the lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take her second loan via VisionFund. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more money and improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy recycled material for her husband to resell to factories

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has 1 child. She operates a retail business where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that, in the future, she will open other businesses. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is a Kiva borrower. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regular. 

She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have good living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement is 34 years old. He is married with 6 children. He has had a retail shop business for 6 years. He will be using the loan to purchase more stock of flour, rice, cooking oil, sugar and milk to sell to his customers. He hopes this will help get more income to educate his children and expand his business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a good business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of maize flour, rice, cooking oil, sugar and milk to sell.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 15,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and has four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 20 years, she has owned a food stall business, where she sells to neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with seven children, none of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 14 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom is 42 years old and a mother of four children. Three of the children are in school. They are living in Mondulkiri province. The sources of her family’s income are from cassava farming and working on other farms (an additional source of income for her family). She has been involved in this business for four years and it earns her about 88,200 KHR per day. This is the second loan for her group with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for the plowing fee for her farm. She hopes this loan will help her to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy garments for both her husband and herself to resell

loans.name: Luis David

texts.es:
Luis es un joven muy entregado a su trabajo pues a sus 19 años de edad trabaja incasablemente todos los días de la semana de lunes a domingo en su negocio de producción y venta de mazamorra. 

Ve una oportunidad de una entidad como Interactuar que le brinda la confianza de tener un crédito para mejorar su negocio y soñar con su fábrica de producción de mazamorra y hacerle creer que es posible alcanzar este sueño. 
Le dedica de 6 a 8 5 horas diarias a su negocio.

Solicita un crédito para la reparación del vehículo en el cual transporta su producto y para la compra de maíz y bocadillos.
 
Con la ayuda de este crédito Luis producirá mas alimentos y le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos para cada día tener mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a young man who is quite dedicated to his work.  At 19-years old, he works tirelessly every day of the week, Monday to Sunday, in his business producing and selling "mazamorra" (a milky, maize pudding). He works 6-8 hours a day. 

Luis sees an opportunity with an entity such as Interactuar, which is giving him the confidence to take out a loan in order to improve his business.  He wants to have a "mazamorra" production factory, and Interactuar has made him believe in possibility of his dream. 

Luis is requesting a loan to repair the vehicle he uses to transport his product and to purchase corn and sandwiches. 
 
With the help of this loan, Luis will be able to produce more food.  This, in turn, will allow him to earn a better income so that with each day, he will have improved life opportunities.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle he uses to transport his product and to purchase corn and sandwiches.

loans.name: For Christ Group

texts.en:
The For Christ Group is made up of four able people who live in the same neighborhood. They sell vegetables, smoked fish, eggs, conditioners, toothpaste and brushes. The featured borrower of this group is named Theodora. She is 44, married and has four children. 

Theodora has been selling vegetables and smoked fish for 22 years at the market, which enables her to provide for her family satisfactorily. She buys the fish, smoking supplies and vegetables from the farmers and sells them to her customers. 

Hoping to improve service to her customers, Theodora and the other members of the for Christ group are requesting their fifth loan from ID-Ghana in order to raise the standard of their activities. The previous loans were correctly repaid and as usual they will hold each other responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To  buy the fish, smoking supplies and vegetables from the farmers and sells them to her customers

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a married man and has been blessed with three children all of whom attend school. Together with his wife, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

He has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Ovidio Jose

texts.es:
Ovidio es un hombre de campo y padre de 4 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos pollos para cría y materiales para la construcción de un galpón. 

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a un hombre trabajador con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Ovidio is a farmer and a father of four.  He has had to face a lot of adversity in his life on behalf of his children.  Even so, he has always had the strength to get ahead and continue forward with his family.  

For some time, Ovidio has wanted to start a business raising and selling chickens.  That is why he is requesting some big financial encouragement, so he can buy some chickens to raise and build a coop.  With this new business, Ovidio will be able to generate an income for his family; everything he does is for them.  He will be able to improve his wife's and his children's quality of life.

Ovidio will work every day to launch his business and make it a sustainable and profitable enterprise. 

Help out a hard-working man by giving him a loan!

loans.use: to purchase some chickens to raise and buy materials to build a coop.

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es:
Luis, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos que estudian 4to y 5to grado, la mayor parte de ingresos provienen de su trabajo para mantener a su familia y nadie más vive con ellos. 

Luis, es albañil desde hace 10 años y aprendió cuando era ayudante de otros señores, anteriormente trabajo en el Ingenio Chapararrastique y actualmente trabaja construyendo unos cuartos a unos 20 minutos de su hogar y se va en bicicleta. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar un aparato de soldadura, porque también tiene conocimientos de estructuras metálicas y tiene trabajos de este tipo, pero debido a falta de herramientas no los realiza. 

El sueño de Luis, es tener más herramientas para realizar diversos tipos de trabajos y así obtener más dinero para el mantenimiento de su familia y desea que sus hijos terminen el año escolar sin problemas.
texts.en:
Luis, age 36, studied until the sixth grade. He lives with his life partner who dedicates to the home chores. He has two children attending to 4th and 5th grade. Most of his incomes come from his work to sustain his family. No one else lives with them.

Luis has been a construction worker for the past 10 years. He learned this trade as a helper of other men. He previously worked at the sugar factory Chapararrastique, but now he works building rooms 20 minutes away from his home, a place to where he goes by bike.

He needs the loan to buy a welding tool. He has some knowledge on metal structures, but even though he has job offers for this type of work, he doesn’t have the tools to perform them. 

Luis’ dream is to have more tools to make different types of jobs and thus obtain more money to sustain his family. He also wishes for his children to finish the school year without problems.

loans.use: to buy a welding tool.

loans.name: Fotemogoban  B Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Fotemogoban  B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kokouna, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso enfin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs avec Alimatou  débout  en première position sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 170 000 francs CFA  par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Fotemogoban B” are married women, who average 33 years of age and six children each, all living in traditional families in Kokouna, a village in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 6th loan with the institution, and the past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is: corn, as is the case with Alimatou, who is standing in the first spot in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing for maintaining: 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 170,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help out her big family in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants Groupement" Khoudia"

texts.fr:
Le groupement « épouses des enseignants Khoudia » rassemble cinq femmes qui logent dans le même quartier et s’activent dans le commerce.
Khoudia, du nom du groupement, est la présidente. Elle a 46 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont la fille ainée est âgée de 28 ans et la cadette, de7 ans. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20 ans car elle a démarré très tôt avec sa mère qu’elle accompagnait  au marché et qui lui a appris le métier. Ce métier qui consiste à transformer le poisson frais en poisson salé, à le sécher pour le revendre.
Madame Khoudia participe activement à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne, elle souhaite acquérir un terrain et le construire pour le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
The group called “Épouses des enseignants Khoudia” is composed of five women staying in the same district and who are active in commerce. Ms. Khoudia, the group’s namesake, is the president. She is 46 years old and a married mother of eight children, of whom the oldest is a 28-years-old daughter, and the youngest is a 7-year-old daughter. 

Ms. Khoudia  has over twenty years of experience, since she began very early with her mother, whom she used to accompany to the market and who taught her the trade, which involves salting fresh fish to dry it, for resale. 

Ms. Khoudia actively participates in managing day-to-day expenses. Her wish is to acquire a plot of land and to build on it for her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to process and resell

loans.name: Gloria Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia es una señora muy trabajadora, ella tiene su esposo que se dedica al comercio de ganado y a la agricultura. Cecilia tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 23, 29 y 36 años, Celia conmenta que sus 2 hijos menores se encuentran estudiando, Cecilia es costurera y tambien se dedica a la venta de ropa, Cecilia tiene la aspirasion de seguir trabajando en sus actividades y junto a su esposo conseguir los recursos necesarios para pagar la educacion de sus hijos y que es muy caro ya que estan es la universidad.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a very hardworking woman. She has a husband who makes a living in livestock trade and agriculture. Cecilia has three children of ages 23, 29, and 36 years old. Cecilia says that her two younger children are studying. 

Cecilia is a seamstress and she also sells clothes. Cecilia has aspirations of continuing to work in these activities and together with her husband get the resources necessary to pay for the education of their children. It is very expensive as they are studying at the university.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Samon's Group

texts.en: Samon is 56 years old and a mother of five children, only one of whom is in school. She has been a cassava farmer and a grocery seller for 10 years, living in Mondulkiri province. This is the second loan for her with VisionFund. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay the labor fee for her farming. She hopes this loan will help her to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to pay the labor fee

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: A 23-year-old mother of a small child, Mom has been a rice farmer for five years in Kratie province. Fishing is an additional source of her family’s income. Through these businesses, she can earn about 30,000 KHR daily and can save around 15,000 KHR for emergency needs. Due to a lack of funds, she is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy a small fishing boat to support her current businesses. She hopes to earn more money and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a small fishing boat

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Ella es Rosalba, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su familia.

Ella decidió por iniciar con un negocio de venta de comestibles y bebidas desde hace aproximadamente 20 años en un pequeño local con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica, con la necesidad y el gusto por las ventas, esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio con la ayuda de los prestadores de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar dulces y gaseosas al por mayor para aumentar su inventario.

Con este crédito podrá sostener su negocio y hacerlo crecer cada día más.

Es una mujer que asume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
This is Rosalba.  She is a benevolent woman of good character who wants to improve her situation and get ahead with her family. 

Rosalba decided to start a business in a small store front approximately twenty years ago.  She sells food and drinks.  She started her business with a lot of enthusiasm and spirit.  She learned the trade experientially out of a need to make sales, and she enjoyed it.  It allowed her to get a lot of experience. 

Currently, Rosalba wants to give her business a little push with the help of the Kiva lenders and Interactuar Corporation.  She needs a loan to purchase wholesale sweets and sodas so she can increase her inventory. With the loan, Rosalba will be able to support her business and make it grow a little more each day. 

Rosalba is a woman who takes on challenges and faces them with courage.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale sweets and sodas so she can increase her inventory.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres du groupe    KOTOGNOGONTALA II sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kokouna, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso enfin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Bourama assis en deuxième  position de la   gauche vert le droite sur la photo, il  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et des femmes. IL compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 450.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group KOTOGNOGONTALA II are married men, who average 40 years of age and six children each, all living in traditional families in Kokouna, a village in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The men are collaborating with the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm working during the rainy season. They are on their 6th loan with the institution, and the past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with Bourama, who is sitting first from the left in the photo. He intends to use his loan to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing for maintaining: 3 hectares. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in SIKASSO. He plans on making an average monthly profit of 450,000 francs CFA. This profit will enable him to pay back his loan and also to help the big family to meet day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase perfumes.

loans.name: Kotognogontala I Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe    KOTOGNOGONTALA I sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kokouna, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec  Lamine  debout en première position de la droite vert la gauche sur la photo, il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et des femmes. IL compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 400.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

They are on their 6th loan with the institution, and the past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with Lamine, who is standing first from the right in the photo. He intends to use his loan to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing for maintaining: 3 hectares. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and at SIKASSO markets. He plans on making an average profit of 400,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable him to pay back his loan and also to help the extended family to meet day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing

loans.name: Maritza Emperatriz

texts.es:
Maritza, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo año de bachillerato, está casada y su esposo es albañil, tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales dos viven con ellos y estudian 6to y 9no grado y el otro ya está acompañado.

Maritza, es comerciante de ropa y tiene 19 años de hacerlo, este negocio lo aprendió por medio de su madre; ella sale a vender a los cantones más cercanos y sale muy temprano y regresa en la tarde y solamente lo hace cuatro días a la semana. 

El préstamo lo necesita para compra ropa de mujer como blusas, pantalones y ropa interior femenina.-  Anteriormente, se le otorgó un crédito para el mismo destino, el cuela le ayudo mucho para mantener su negocio. 

El sueño de Maritza, es que su negocio crezca y poder colocar un local en algún sector seguro, además, desea que sus hijos sean profesionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
Maritza is 46-years old.  She went to school through her second year of high school.  She is married, and her husband is a bricklayer.  Maritza and her husband have three children, two of whom live with them.  They are in 6th and 9th grades respectively.  Maritza's other child is married.  

Maritza sells clothing and has been doing so for nineteen years.  She learned the business from her mother.  Maritza makes her sales in the nearest cantons.  She leaves very early in the morning and returns in the afternoon.  She works four days a week. 

Maritza needs a loan to purchase women's clothing, such as blouses, pants and women's undergarments.  She was previously granted a loan for the same purpose, and it really helped her to maintain her business. 

Maritza's hope is for her business to grow.  She also wants to be able to set up a shop in a storefront in a safe area.  In addition, she wants her children to have careers in the future.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing, such as blouses, pants and women's undergarments.

loans.name: Noupagagnon I Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   NOUPAGAGNON I sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 7 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kokouna, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs avec Oumar debout au milieu sur la photo, il compte acheter avec  prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. IL compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 950.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing

loans.name: Jekafo 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  JEKAFO 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à TIOLA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame Chata assise au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1/2 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "JEKAFO 2” are married women, who average 48 years of age and six children each, living for the most part in traditional families in TIOLA, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 7th loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is: peanuts, as is the case with Ms. Chata, who is sitting in the middle in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for half of a 50-kg sack of fertilizer and the cost of plowing to maintain: 0.25 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers paying with cash or credit, in the village in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 60,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Noupagagnon Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON II sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 7 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kokouna, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

loans.name: Jekafo 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  JEKAFO 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à TIOLA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame Awa débout à la première position de la  gauche vers la  droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme   JEKAFO 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
