The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 7th loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is: peanuts, as is the case with Ms. Awa, who is standing first from the left in the photo of this women’s group JEKAFO 1. With her loan, she intends to pay for two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer, a container of herbicide, and the cost of plowing to maintain: 1 hectare

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers paying with cash or credit, in the village in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 125,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Wezenidibam Group

texts.fr: Jacqueline, responsable du groupe remercie kiva ainsi que tous ses prêteurs pour le soutien. Avec le prêt, elle a pu géré sa buvette. Elle a eu un bénéfice qui lui a permis de payer la scolarité de sa fille, de faire toutes les dépenses de sa famille. En plus de tout cela , elle a pu acheter une moto et aussi construire une maison. Le groupe a fait ses remboursements à temps. Jacqueline a besoin d'un nouveau prêt pour continuer son activité. Elle projette acheter une autre parcelle avec son bénéfice et faire les dépenses de sa maison.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, the official of the group, thanks Kiva, as well as all her lenders, for the support. With the loan, she was able to manage her drink stand. She had a loan enabling her to pay for her daughters schooling and cover all her family’s expenses. In addition to all this, she was able to purchase a motorbike and also to build a house. 

The group made its payments on time. Jacqueline has need of a new loan to continue her business. She plans to buy another parcel of land with her profits and to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her bar and to offer a diversified menu to her customers

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.es:
Reina, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, tiene 5 hijos, pero solo 3 dependen económicamente de ella; está casada y su esposo vive en los EEUU. Dos de sus hijos están estudiando, uno está en la escuela y el otro en la universidad.

Reina, tiene 11 años de trabajar como empleada doméstica y también vende pastelitos de carne y yuca frita los domingos, para ir a venderlos a la cancha de fútbol.

El préstamo lo necesita para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, específicamente quiere arreglar el techo de su casa, porque está deteriorado.

Reina, sueña con que sus hijos se preparen académicamente y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Reina, 41 years old, studied until the 7th grade. She has 5 children but only 3 depend on her financially. She is married and her husband lives in the USA. Two of her children are studying, one in school and one in a university. 

Reina has been working as a domestic maid for 11 years and also sells meat pies and fried cassava on Sundays. She goes out to sell them at the football field. 

She needs the loan to improve her home. Specifically, she wants to fix the roof of her home because it has deteriorated. 

Reina dreams for her children to prepare themselves academically and to get careers.

loans.use: to improve her home. Specifically, she wants to fix the roof of her home because it has deteriorated.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, de 60 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es viuda y tiene dos hijos que ya están casados, uno vive aparte y el otro vive con ella y ya tiene un hijo. 

María, tiene un negocio de venta de panes con pollo desde hace 18 años y además vende pupusas, para trabajar en este negocio alquila una casa a dos cuadras de su casa; todos los días tiene que pagar taxi para ir al supermercado a comprar los preparativos y trabaja de martes a domingo. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una plancha nueva, porque la que tiene es muy pequeña y no da abasto; además comprara leña para cocer el pollo.

María, sueña con terminar de pagar su casa y dejarles esa casa a sus hijos y también dejarles el negocio de los panes con pollo, para que se superen económicamente.
texts.en:
María, 60, studied until the second grade. She is a widow and has two children who are married, one of whom lives at Maria's house with his son.

For 18 years Maria has had a business selling chicken sandwiches and pupusas [stuffed tortillas], working Tuesday to Sunday. She rents a house two blocks from her home to use for her business. Every day she has to pay a taxi to take her to the supermarket to buy the ingredients.

This loan will be used to buy a new griddle because the one she has is very small and not sufficient. She also will buy firewood for cooking the chicken.

Maria dreams of paying off her house and leaving it to her children along with her business so that they can support themselves financially.

loans.use: to buy a new griddle.

loans.name: Sonia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Sonia, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y su pareja se dedica a las estructuras metálicas, tiene dos hijos, ellos viven en casa y están estudiando. 

Sonia, es empleada, trabaja cuidando niños y tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este trabajo, también le ayuda en las estructuras metálicas con su esposo y trabaja  a 30 minutos de su casa. 

Sonia, necesita el crédito para comprar ladrillos para terminar de construir su casa.

Sonia, sueña con tener una casa en mejores condiciones y darle mejores oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia, 40, studied until high school. She is married and her husband is a metal worker. They have two children who live with them and are still in school.

Sonia is a domestic employee. She has been taking care of children for 4 years and her job is about 30 minutes from home. She also helps her husband with his metal work.

Sonia needs a loan to buy bricks to finish building her house. She dreams of having a house that is in better condition, and of being able to give her children better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy bricks to finish building her house.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a married woman with two children. She operates a computer services business where she offers internet browsing, typesetting, etc. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential for growth. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. 

Peninah will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more printing materials and other necessary items for her business. Her goal is to open other locations within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Peninah's previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more printing materials and other necessary items for her computer services business.

loans.name: Brenda Sarai

texts.es:
Brenda, de 25 años de edad, es una mujer de trabajadora, estudió hasta primer año de secundaria, está acompañada y junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura y tiene 2 hijos.

Brenda, se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a cuidar de sus hijos, mientras su esposo desde tempranas horas de la madrugada, sale a trabajar en las labores del campo,  específicamente siembra maíz y pipían, si embargo cuando Brenda, tiene un espacio disponible, también le ayuda a su esposo.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar insumos agrícolas, como abono, herbicidas, insecticidas y fungicidas, que son necesarios para el buen mantenimiento de los cultivos.

Brenda, sueña con darle la oportunidad de estudio a sus hijos y que logren ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Brenda, 25, is a hardworking woman. She studied through her first year of high school. She is married and has two children. Brenda and her husband work together on their farm. Brenda takes care of the home and watches the children, while her husband gets up very early and goes to work in the fields where they grow corn and squash. When Brenda has free time she helps her husband.

This loan is to buy agricultural inputs like compost, herbicides, insecticides, and fungicides which are necessary for maintaining their crops.

Brenda dreams of giving her children the opportunity to study and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like compost, herbicides, insecticides and fungicides.

loans.name: Diego Hernando

texts.es:
En la pintura de hogares encuentran muchas personas una oportunidad para progresar y salir delante de una manera humilde y con mucho coraje, tal es el caso de Diego que a sus 45 años es un reconocido pintor.

Utiliza varias técnicas y tiene gran experiencia en este campo.

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar la reparación de su compresor de aire, el cual le permitirá continuar con su labor con el cual ha intentado obtener algunos ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos y aportar con la economía de su hogar.

Una de las grandes dificultades que ha tenido que enfrentar es alto costo de los insumos.

Apoya a Diego con su oficio y haz que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Painting houses is a way many people find an opportunity to prosper and get ahead in their humble, courageous way.  This is the case of Diego who is 45 and a well-known painter.  He uses different techniques and has vast experience in the field.

He is requesting a loan to repair the air compressor he uses in his work which is his way of earning an income to support his children and contribute to the household economy.

One of the great difficulties he faces are the high cost of supplies.  

Please support Diego in his trade and make his life better with your loan!

loans.use: To repair the air compressor he needs to continue working.

loans.name: Lucelly

texts.es:
Lucelly es una mujer trabajadora y humilde, cualidades que tiene muy bien merecidas ya que su labor de zapatera le han dado la oportunidad de conseguir el sustento para su familia.

Inicio este negocio hace 9 años a través del conocimiento empírico.

Hoy en día trabaja sola durante unas 3 horas diarias.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar materia prima como cuero, pega, clavos, entre otros, elementos que le permitirán abastecer su negocio y poder generar una mejor producción de calzado.

Ayuda a Lucelly a cumplir su sueño de pagar la educación de sus hijos a través de su digno oficio.
texts.en:
Lucelly is a hard-working, humble woman whose shoe-making skills have given her the opportunity to support her family.  She started the business nine years ago and learned the trade on her own.  She works alone three hours a day.

The loan she is requesting is to buy raw materials such as leather, glue, nails and other items that she needs to stock her business and produce a better quality product.

Please help Lucelly achieve her goal of giving her children an education through her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as leather, glue, nails and other items to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies to plant corn and millet.

loans.name: Jekafo 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres du groupe  JEKAFO 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à TIOLA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame Baro  debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Jekafo 3 group are married women with an average age of 47 and with six children each on average. Most of them live in traditional families in Tiola near Sikasso - the third largest administrative area of Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to succeed with their farm work over the winter period.
This is their seventh harvest loan with Soro Yiriwaso, the previous ones have all been repaid in full. 
Baro (standing on the far left in the photo) grows peanuts. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50kg sacks of fertiliser, and to pay the costs of ploughing 0.75 hectare.
Following the harvest, the crop is sold in the village and in Sikasso, to both men and women - for cash and credit. She plans to make an average profit of 115,000 FCFA from each harvest. This profit will enable her to repay her loan, and also to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertiliser and herbicide, and to pay ploughing costs.

loans.name: Jiguiya 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JIGUIYA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  46 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Nougoume dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame Awa débout au milieu  sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à niena  à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 163 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Jiguiya 1 group are married women with an average age of 46 and with four children each on average. Most of them live in traditional families in Nougoume near Sikasso - the third largest administrative area of Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to succeed with their farm work over the winter period.
This is their fourth harvest loan with Soro Yiriwaso, the previous ones have all been repaid in full. 
Awa (standing in the centre of the photo) grows peanuts. With her loan, she plans to buy three 50kg sacks of fertiliser, one bottle of herbicide and to pay the costs of ploughing 1.5 hectares.
Following the harvest, the crop is sold in the village and in Sikasso, to both men and women - for cash and credit. She plans to make an average profit of 163,000 FCFA from each harvest. This profit will enable her to repay her loan, and also to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertiliser and herbicides, and to pay the costs of ploughing.

loans.name: Jekafo 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe  JEKAFO 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à TIOLA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame Fatoumata debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Jekafo 4 group are married women with an average age of 46 and with five children each on average. Most of them live in traditional families in Tiola near Sikasso - the third largest administrative area of Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to succeed with their farm work over the winter period.
This is their seventh harvest loan with Soro Yiriwaso, the previous ones have all been repaid in full. 
Fatoumata (standing on the far left in the photo) grows peanuts. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50kg sacks of fertiliser, and to pay the costs of ploughing one hectare.
Following the harvest, the crop is sold in the village and in Sikasso, to both men and women - for cash and credit. She plans to make an average profit of 115,000 FCFA from each harvest. This profit will enable her to repay her loan, and also to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertiliser and herbicides, and to pay the costs of ploughing.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 50 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 28. They all go to school and they are in private schools. She owns a shop and she has been doing business for the past 5 years. Her husband is a businessman too. She is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children, and she would like to repay in instalments. After paying school fees, she plans to expand her business in order to help prepare a better future for herself.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her four children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a butchery. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Totstop School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fred. He is the Director of Totstop School, a mixed school in the rural area of Lusaka in Hoima with 90 students. Totstop School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. 

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Totstop School will repay its loan with its school fees, which it collects each term. Fred ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with three children, who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

She has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Jiguiya 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JIGUIYA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  46 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Nougoumè dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrime prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame Rokia Sidi débout au milieu  sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à Niena  à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Jiguiya 2 group are married women who on average are 46 years old with five children. Most live in traditional households in Nougoume, part of the circle of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their fourth seasonal loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, and previous loans have been fully repaid.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Rokia Sidi, who is standing in the middle of the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay for plowing to cultivate one hectare (2.44 acres).

After the harvest the production is sold in the village, in Niena and Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She hopes to attain average profits of 105,000 CFA francs per crop season. These profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband deal with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicides, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, milk, soap, and rice. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, rice, milk, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, rice, milk, sugar and other items

loans.name: St. Jude & St. Christina School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Noeline. She is the Director of St. Jude & St. Christina Nursery & Primary Schools, mixed schools in the rural area of Kahoora in Hoima with a total of 1,000 students. St. Jude & St. Christina School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with 1,000 & 450 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Jude & St. Christina Schools will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Noeline ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 20 years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 44 years old. She is married with six children between the ages of 4 and 22 years. They all go to school and they are in technical schools. She sells clothes and she has been doing business for the past 6 years. Her husband is a businessman too. She is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children, and she would like to repay in instalments. After paying school fees, she plans to make more savings in the same business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her six children

loans.name: The Lord's Group

texts.en: The Lord's Group consists of three members whose efforts and struggles have brought them to join ID-Ghana for their third loan. They sell assorted fresh fish, beads and second hand clothing. Dora is the representative borrower; she has been selling assorted second hand clothing for nine years. She is applying for this loan to buy more assorted second hand clothing to sell to her customers. This will help her to finalize her business plan and thus improve her income. She is 35 years old and married with one child. Together with their colleagues, the group members have received orientation about loans and microfinance, so they are aware of the work and efforts expected from them in a continuous and permanent manner to ultimately be successful and provide a better life for their families. They continuously monitor training and verification that somehow requires and also encourages the women to fight to escape poverty. The group needs a total amount of 3,000 GHS to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more assorted second hand clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Bumbaire School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Bening. He is the Director of Bumbaire Secondary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Bushenyi with 400 students. Bumbaire School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Bumbaire School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Bening ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is from the village of Vaziani, where she lives with her husband who is a private overseer of a residential building. Nani works as a cleaner to cover the basic needs of her family. However, they still live under the poverty line as their incomes are low, and they need financial support. 

Because of the above-mentioned situation, Nani lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit to start a business. The Start-Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Nani to get a loan of 1,200 GEL to start an agribusiness. 

Nani will purchase a cow and will start milking it, and then she and her husband will sell milk products at the local market in order to get additional income. They are relying on the goodwill of Kiva lenders and will greatly appreciate your help and support, as the family's living conditions will significantly improve after this loan. 

Nani awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and start an agribusiness

loans.name: Jiguiya 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres du groupe JIGUIYA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  46 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Nougoume dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame Awa assise en première position de la droite vers la gauche débout au milieu  sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à Niena  à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Jiguiya 3 group are married women who on average are 46 years old with five children. Most live in traditional households in Nougoume, part of the circle of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their fourth seasonal loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, and previous loans have been fully repaid.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Awa, who is sitting in the first position from right to left of the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay for plowing to cultivate one hectare (2.44 acres).

After the harvest the production is sold in the village, in Niena and Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She hopes to attain average profits of 175,000 CFA francs per crop season. These profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband deal with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicides, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard, who is 35 years old, is from the Zugdidi district. He lives with his brother, sister and pensioner mother. Eduard and his brother do physical work and they earn a small daily income. 

Eduard decided to start a new business additionally and has requested a loan. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,200 USD. With the credit he receives, he will purchase some special equipment for cars at wholesale prices, and will then resell it in the Zugdidi district. This equipment is used in cars for signalling. 

Eduard hopes that the business will be profitable and that he will gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase some equipment that is used in cars for signalling, and then resell it at a higher price

loans.name: Top Class Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Top Class and they are on their fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The businesses run by the members include batik clothing, cosmetics and grocery. The loan that they will receive will benefit micro businesses like Margaret's. This is Margaret's fourth year with ID-Ghana. She joined after a friend, who is a member of the institution, invited her.

Margaret currently has a business selling cosmetics. She began this business through a friend, who showed her how to acquire and sell this product. The loan that she has requested is to increase her working capital so that she can purchase more ready-made cosmetics to sell to customers. She will purchase cosmetics from the wholesalers and later sell at her residence in a kiosk. This job allows her to generate income to support her family. She is 36 years old, married and has children. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the other members of the group because they are kind.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics from the wholesalers and later sell at her residence in a kiosk.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia, 44 years old, is married and has five children. She sells wigs, shampoo, and hair creams in Accra. Her customers are located all around Accra. This loan is Cynthia's seventh transaction with ID Ghana. She will use the loan to buy wigs, shampoo, and hair creams to sell to her customers at her residence. Cynthia has requested this loan because she needs to serve more customers. Cynthia faces challenges in her business, such as dealing with competition in the area, since there are several neighborhood competitors in the area. She will use her profits to continue buying more wigs, shampoo, and hair creams so that she can increase her capital.

loans.use: To buy wigs, shampoo, and hair creams to sell to her customers at her residence.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en: Ivy was born in 1976. She is a woman who always tries to work hard for the well-being of her family. She works hard to help her husband because together they are responsible for taking care of their three children. Ivy always wanted to have her own business. She began her business selling smoked fish 11 years ago. Little by little, she developed her business. She successfully runs her own business. Ivy wants to increase her working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of GHS 2,300 to buy more fish and firewood to smoke the fish and sell to customers. This is her fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and her first with Kiva. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy more fish and firewood to smoke fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jiguiya 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe JIGUIYA 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  49 ans, ont en moyenne 7 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Nougoume dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame Djeneba debout e deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à Niena  à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Jiguiya 4 group are married women who on average are 49 years old with seven children. Most live in traditional households in Nougoume, part of the circle of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their fourth seasonal loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, and previous loans have been fully repaid.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Djeneba, who is standing in the second position from left to right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay for plowing to cultivate one hectare (1.23 acres).

After the harvest the production is sold in the village, in Niena and Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She hopes to attain average profits of 110,000 CFA francs per crop season. These profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband deal with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicides, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 41 years old and is from the Sagarejo district. She lives with her pensioner mother and 2 children. 

Nana works as a consultant at a local shop. Besides this, she is involved in agricultural activities. She has 2 cows, some hens and also owns a vineyard. She is a very hardworking woman, and she produces wine and dairy products to sell. 

Nana has been working as a consultant for many years and is now very motivated to open her own shop. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 9,000 GEL to open a shop. She is going to open a shop and will work hard to increase the family income and improve her family's living conditions. 

Nana hopes that, with your help, she will make her dream of owning and managing a shop come true.

loans.use: to open a shop and increase the family income

loans.name: Alpha Na Omega Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her early 40s, is married with two children, one of whom is still in school and the other one is grown-up. 

Joyce has been growing and selling her vegetables for eight years now. She works from 6am to 10am (four hours only) and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Joyce's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to irrigate her garden, and she managed to get vegetables to sell to many customers. She used the profit to pay school fees, the loan repayment and covered household expenses.   

She will use this loan to buy seeds, manure and water to develop her garden and to increase her stock of vegetables. She dreams of buying a big plot of land in order to grow more vegetables.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group, Alpha Na Omega, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and water to develop her garden and to increase her stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Kankelentigui 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  KANKELENTIGUI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Dembela dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwo, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec madame Karidia débout à la première position de la  gauche vers  droite la sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe de 50 kg, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à Niena  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175 000 francs CFA par campagne.

The selected crop is maize featuring Mrs. Karidia, who is standing in the first position from left to right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy three bags of urea, two 50-kilo bags of compound fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay for plowing to cultivate 1.5 hectares (2.44 acres).

After the harvest the production is sold in the village, in Niena and Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She hopes to attain average profits of 175,000 CFA francs per crop season. These profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband deal with daily expenses.

loans.name: Kweboni Ehi Group

texts.en:
The three members in the photo are part of the group called Kweboni Ehi, and they all live in the same neighborhood. They sell bags, groceries and smoked fish. 

George (seen in the photo standing third on the left) is the group's representative. He is 40 years old and married with two children. George has been selling groceries from his residence for 7 years. This allows him to take care of his family. He buys his groceries from the wholesaler's and resells them from his residence in Ghana. 

George and the other members of his group would like to improve their businesses, so they have requested a third loan from the field partner ID Ghana. Their previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: To buy groceries from the wholesaler's and resell them from his residence in Ghana.

loans.name: Pillao Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PILLAO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Yanet  continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gallinas entre otros.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
Al momento de tomar la foto una de las socias salio con la cara tapada ya que la socia es timida, pero se compromete para la proxima salir en la foto.
texts.en:
The group members belong the the communal bank "PILLAO", which is situated in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and department of Cusco.

A member, Yanet, continues with her business raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She is a responsible and hardworking person. She continues raising her animals to then sell them to her customers who request them. She has had her business for a considerable time and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.

She is asking for the loan to buy chickens among other items.

The group members who appear in the inset photo asked permission to arrive late at the meeting for work reasons.

Yanet thanks those who form part of this dream through this medium and promises to make the loan repayments within the time specified. 

When taking the photo, one of the group members came out with her face covered because she is shy, but she is committed to appear in the next photo.

loans.use: to buy chickens and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more cassava and plantain to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in underwear, pyjamas, accessories and ladies clothing for resale

loans.name: Kankelentigui 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  KANKELENTIGUI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Dembela dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwASo, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec madame Karidia débout au milieu sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe de 50 kg, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à Niena  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Kankelentigui 5 group are married women with an average age of 45 and, on average, 5 children, who mostly live in traditional families in Dembela, in the Sikasso Circle, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their 8th loan cycle with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso and their previous loans have been properly repaid.

Karidia, standing in the middle of the photo, grows maize. She plans to use her loan to buy 3 bags of fertiliser urea, 2 50-kilo bags of compound fertiliser, and one can of herbicide, and to pay for the manual labour needed to maintain 1.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Niena to a clientele made up of men and women for cash or credit. She expects to make an average profit of 175 000 per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and herbicides and to pay the manual labour.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Cecilia is 39 years old and has four children who are in school.

Ma. Cecilia has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Cecilia requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell to customers.

Ma. Cecilia has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Ma. Cecilia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 39 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are sent in school.

Mary Grace is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Grace has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in paint, a sink, a fridge, a counter and some chairs and tables.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 57 years old and has seven children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Nelly is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nelly requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Nelly has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nelly would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Alifa

texts.pt:
A  senhora Alifa de 35 anos de idade, é viúva, mãe de  04 filhos  destes  2 frequentam o ensino primário 2 ainda menoresde idade e vive na casa própria.
Diz  que com o valor do emprestimo pretende comprar  arroz, óleo, cerveja, açúcar, feijão, amendoim, atum para reforçar o seu negocio .
O seu maior sonho é terminar a sua casa ainda em construcao e melhorar a sua barraca.
Diz que tem como desafio insuficiência de fundos  e que irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en: Alifa is a 35 year old widowed mother to 4 children, 2 of whom currently attend primary school and her younger two are still at home with her. They all live together in their own home. Alifa plans to use this loan to buy rice, cooking oil, beer, sugar, beans, nuts and tuna so that she can restock her business. She dreams of one day finishing the building work on her house, which is currently under construction, and improving her business stall. The greatest challenge that she faces is due to her lack of money and she plans to apply for further loans to help her achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, beer, sugar, beans, nuts and tuna.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 61 year old married woman with six grown children. She earns a living by selling crabs to the local in her  place. Her husband is a fisherman.  She is the one who sells his husband's catch. She has been engaged in that kind of business for 4 years now and is in need of materials in order to improve her livelihood. 

Evelyn has requested a loan to buy fishing materials like crab traps. With these materials, her husband's catch will  improve and enable them to have more yield. Thus, it will cause to augment her finances and settle her obligation as well. 

She hopes that she could properly handle her fishing livelihood to become sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like crab traps to improve the family finances

loans.name: Kankelentigui 7 Group

Flanouma, standing second from the right in the picture, grows maize. She plans to use her loan to buy 3 bags of fertiliser urea, 2 50-kilo bags of compound fertiliser, and one can of herbicide, and to pay the manual labourers needed to maintain 1.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Niena to a clientele made up of men and women for cash or credit. She expects to make an average profit of 185 000 per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and herbicide and to pay the manual labourers.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 44 years old, married to Jackline and supports a family of six children. He has been practicing farming for the last 14 years earning KES9,000 per month. 

Evans has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to open a retail shop in the area. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray her crops to increase production.

loans.name: Marcedita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Marcedita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fruits. Marcedita is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Marcedita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and thus expand her business

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is the age of 44, mother of three children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh fruits at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this fruit shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the fruits. Therefore her wife, Abida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal fruits. Abida thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits for her husband's business

loans.name: Laarazu

texts.en:
Laarazu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bazana II Village. Laarazu joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Laarazu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.  

This season, Laarazu  has grand plans to harvest 60 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Laarazunow has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yield in maize production

loans.name: Zakia's Group

texts.en:
Zakia is 39 years old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons and three daughters. She maintained her house hold activities properly. She has been running a beauty salon for the last few years. She is well trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, her number of clients increases day by day. 

So she requires some beauty salon related items such as facial creams, combs, furniture items like dressing chairs, mirrors, etc. Therefore Zakia made contact to kiva field partner brac Pakistan. Brac staff visited her enterprise and a issued loan. 
She is very thankful to brac Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy facial creams, combs, furniture items like dressing chairs, mirrors, etc. for her own beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, building blocks and rods, and corrugated sheeting.

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt:
A senhora Celina de 40 anos de  idade é devorciada, mae de 04 filhos dos quais 02 menores de idade a frequentar o ensino primario, dois maiores de idade a estudar, vive na casa propria.
Com o valor do emprestimo ira comprar ferro, cimento, pedra, areia para concluir a sua obra. 
Mobilar, pintar a sua casadeixando-a mais confortavel e adiquirir uma viatura para uso pessoal e transporte de mercadorias sao os seus planos para o futuro.
Principais desafios e a falta de dinheiro, doencas e elevado custo de vida para ultrapassa los  ira levantar mais creditos como forma de alcancar seus objectivos.
texts.en: Celina is a 40 year old divorced mother to 4 children: two of whom are of pre-school age and her elder two attend primary school. They all live together in their own home. She plans to use this loan to buy iron rods, cement, stone and building sand in order to finish the work on her house. In the future, she plans to paint and furnish her home so that is a more comfortable place for her family to live, and she hopes to buy a vehicle for personal use and for transporting her merchandise. The greatest challenges that she faces are in relation to her lack of money, illness, and a high cost of living and she hopes to apply for further loans in order to overcome these difficulties and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy iron rods, cement, stone and building sand

loans.name: Kato Allama 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  KATO ALLAMA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, ont en moyenne 7 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Bougoulaba dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwASo, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame Sanata débout au milieu sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 4 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à Niena  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi  aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Kato Allama 1 group are married women with an average age of 47 and, on average, 7 children, and who mostly live in traditional families in Bougoulaba, in the Sikasso Circle, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their 7th loan cycle with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso and their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Sanata, standing in the middle of the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy 4 50-kilo bags of fertiliser and one can of herbicide, and to pay for the manual labour needed to maintain 1.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Niena to a clientele made up of men and women for cash or credit. She expects to make an average profit of 165 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and herbicide and to pay for manual labour.

loans.name: Kankelentigui 8 Group

texts.fr:
Les 06 membres du groupe KANKELENTIGUI 8 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Dembela dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec madame Maïmouna débout à la deuxième position de la  gauche vers  droite la sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sacs d’urée, 1 sacs de complexe de 50 kg, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à Niena  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 6 members of the Kankelentigui 8 group are married women with an average age of 46 and, on average, 6 children, who mostly live in traditional families in Dembela, in the Sikasso Circle, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their 8th loan cycle with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso and their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Maïmouna, standing second from the left in the picture, grows maize. She plans to use her loan to buy one bag of fertiliser urea, one 50-kilo bag of compound fertiliser, and one can of herbicide, and to pay the manual labourers needed to maintain 1 hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Niena to a clientele made up of men and women for cash or credit. She expects to make an average profit of 105 000 per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and herbicide and to pay the manual labourers.

loans.name: Kato Allama 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  KATO ALLAMA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Bougoulaba dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame  Safoura débout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 4 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 170 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Kato Allama 2 group are married women with an average age of 45 and, on average, 5 children, and who mostly live in traditional families in Bougoulaba, in the Sikasso Circle, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their 7th loan cycle with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso and their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Safoura, standing on the left in the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy 4 50-kilo bags of fertiliser and one can of herbicide, and to pay for the manual labour needed to maintain 1.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Sikasso to a clientele made up of men and women for cash or credit. She expects to make an average profit of 170 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and herbicide, and to pay for manual labour.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with 3 children ages 14,18 and 21 year old respectively.  She engages in fishing and sells fresh fish to the local in the community. In addition to that, she also raises and sells hogs, as supplemental income. She needs funds to sustain her hog raising livelihood. 

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and pig supplement.  These would really improve the way she raises hogs and be able to improve her livelihood. Thus, it will help augment her income and she will be able to provide the needs of her children.

She believes that her dedication  and determination to handle her both businesses is the key to success.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and pig supplement to augment her income and the welfare of her children

loans.name: Veenas

texts.en:
Veenas is 40 years old house wife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is the mother of one son. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, oranges from his shop. Presently he is interested to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. 

Therefore his wife, Veenas has requested for a loan amount from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase more variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable price. With the profit amount her husband wants to grow his business in the future. veenas is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fresh fruits for her husband's business so as to improve sales

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 62 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, soft-drinks, rice and other groceries. 

In the future Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell so as to expand her business

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita is 57 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Susanita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Susanita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Susanita has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Susanita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is the age of 39, mother of five children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh fruits at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this fruit shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the fruits. Therefore her wife, Tahira requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal fruits. Tahira thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits for an improvement and expansion in her husband's business

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants"takku Liggey 2" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement Epouses des enseignants » Takku Liggey 2 » rassemble cinq femmes qui s’activent dans le commerce. Leur présidente, madame Yacine, âgée de 48 ans fait de la vente de produits de mer, et cela depuis 7 ans. Yacine est mariée et mère de famille. Elle appuie son époux dans les dépenses de la famille et le développement intellectuel de ses enfants. Son activité consiste à acheter une variété de fruits de mer, à les traiter, les sécher et les mettre en sachets pour les revendre à sa clientèle d’ici ou d’ailleurs. Si ses opérations sont régulières, elle peut avoir un bénéfice considérable qui lui permet de renforcer son fond de roulement.
Dans l’avenir, elle veut davantage améliorer son activité et faire connaitre ses produits partout dans la zone.
texts.en: The "Epouses des enseignants, Takku Liggey 2" group brings together 5 women who are retailers. Their leader, Yacine, is 48 years old and has been selling seafood for 7 years. Yacine is married and a mother. She supports her husband with the family expenses and her children's intellectual development. Her business consists of buying a variety of seafood and processing it, drying it and putting it in small bags in order to resell it to her customers who are both local and from elsewhere. If she is able to operate regularly, she is able to earn a considerable profit which enables her to reinforce her working capital. In the future, she would like to improve her business further and to make her products known throughout the region.

loans.use: to buy seafood to process and resell.

loans.name: Jeyuma Group

texts.fr:
MADOU est le Monsieur qui tient le mouton sur la photo ;c’ est un cultivateur  Malien, non scolarisé  âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 7 enfants  de 1 à 24 ans tous non scolarisés. Il fait l’activité d’élevage  depuis plus de 6 ans et sa femme est une ménagère.
MADOU  s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants  et revend  dans les mêmes marchés. Le bénéfice qu’il en tire lui permet de satisfaire les  besoins de sa famille.
Il emprunte de l’argent au RMCR pour acheter des moutons. 
MADOU  rencontre souvent le problème de mévente  sur le marché. Son rêve est de devenir un exportateur des moutons  dans l’avenir et avoir un prêt plus élevé.
texts.en: Madou is the man holding the sheep in the picture. He is an illiterate Malian farmer who is 45 years old, married and the father of 7 children aged between 1 and 24 years old, none of whom attend school. He has been raising livestock for over 6 years and his wife is a homemaker. Madou gets his supplies at the local markets and resells at the same markets. The profits that he earns enable him to satisfy his family's needs. He is borrowing money from RMCR in order to buy sheep. Madou often has problems making sales at the market. His dream is to become a sheep exporter in the future and to receive a higher loan.

loans.use: to buy sheep for later resale.

loans.name: Danaya N°2 Group

texts.fr:
ISSA est le Monsieur  qui tient le mouton sur la photo, c’est un malien cultivateur, non scolarisé, âgé de 43 ans, marié et père de 6 enfants  âgées  de 5 mois à 13 ans  dont  3 scolarisés. Sa conjointe fait le ménage.
ISSA  fait l’élevage de moutons  depuis 6 ans. Il  s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants  et revend  dans les mêmes marchés, parfois il envoie ses animaux au marché lointain. Le profit qu’il réalise lui permet de  subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
Il  emprunte de l’argent auprès du  RMCR pour financer et accroitre son élevage au moment propice. 
Ayant souvent confronté au problème de vente de ses animaux au marché, ISSA  souhaite  amené  slui-même ses  animaux au marché lointain c’est pourquoi il veut avoir un prêt plus  élevé dans l’avenir pour développer son élevage de mouton.
texts.en:
Issa is the man holding the sheep in the picture. He is an illiterate Malian farmer who is 43 years old, married and the father of 6 children aged between 5 months and 13 years old, three of whom attend school. His spouse is a cleaner. Issa has been raising sheep for 6 years. He gets his supplies at the nearby markets and resells at the same markets, though he occasionally sends his animals to a market far away. The profits that he earns enable him to fulfill his family's needs.

He is borrowing money from RMCR in order to finance and expand his livestock business at an opportune moment. Having often encountered problems making sales at the market, Issa would like to be able to take his animals to the distant market himself, which is why he would like to have a higher loan in future so that he can develop his sheep-rearing business.

loans.use: to buy sheep to resell after raising.

loans.name: Meerbu

texts.ru: Мээрбу, 25 лет, замужем, есть сын. У Мээрбу среднее образование. Она по характеру: трудолюбивая, честная, заботливая. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, Мээрбу занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес 6 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Мээрбу, в хозяйстве есть земельный надел мерою 5,0 ГА, на котором она выращивает фасоль и клевер для реализации. Также 5 коров и 23 овцы, на ежедневной основе продает молоко, экологически-чистое и очень вкусное. Деятельность Мээрбу приносит до 32,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров с телятами для увеличения объемов реализации молока и 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Мээрбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и хочет накопить на строительство сарая.
texts.en: Meerbu is 25 years old, married, and she has a son.  She has a secondary education.  By nature, Meerbu is hardworking, honest and caring.  In order to provide a source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, having started in this field six years ago. Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has five hectares of land on which she grows beans and clover for resale.  She also has five cows and 23 sheep.  She sells delicious organic milk on a daily basis.  Thanks to her activity, she makes up to 32,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy two dairy cows with their calves to increase her sales of milk.  She will also buy 10 sheep.  Meerbu is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business.  She also wants to save enough money toward the construction of a barn.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep for fattening and two dairy cows with their calves to increase her sales of organic milk.

loans.name: Klara

texts.ru: Клара, 27 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Клара с мужем занимаются животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 7 овец, лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Клара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Клара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Klara is 27 years old, married, with three children.  She has a secondary education.  She and her husband are involved in animal husbandry, an activity which constitutes an additional source of income for the family.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has two cows, seven sheep and one horse on her farm.  She makes a monthly income of 16,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 90,000 som (KGS) to buy cows and increase her cattle headcount.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy some cattle in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Mairamkan

texts.ru: Майрамкан, 45 лет, замужем, есть 5 детей. У Майрамкан среднее образование. По характеру она очень трудолюбивая, жизнерадостная. Занимается животноводством, начав с покупки скота на 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Майрамкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своей деятельности, Майрамкан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец. Доходы от кредита Майрамкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на ремонт и внутреннюю отделку дома.
texts.en: Mairamkan is 45 years old, married, with five children.  She has a secondary education.  By nature, she is very hardworking and she has a positive attitude toward life.  She is involved in animal husbandry, having bought her first cattle with an initial capital of 25,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has three cows on her farm.  She makes a monthly income of 11,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her activity, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy calves and sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her livestock headcount.  She also wants to save enough money to repair and renovate the interior of her house.

loans.use: to buy some calves and sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount.
